question_en: why does the file size of digital photos vary when the pixel count doesn't change?
pos_context_title_en: What is the difference between image size, file size, and image quality? (www.sony.com)
Factors affecting file size (digitalmediaresources.weebly.com)
Bitmaps and File Size | Understand How Color Works in Photoshop (www.peachpit.com)
Color Depth (65k, 262k, 16.7M colors) (focuslcds.com)
pos_context_en:
Image size: This represents the physical size and resolution of an image measured in pixels. For example, A 10 megapixel (MP) camera may provide settings to take pictures in 10.2 MP (3872 x 2592), 5.6 MP (2896 x 1944), and 2.5 MP (1936 x 1296). A higher image size setting means a larger picture and bigger file size. A lower image size setting makes a smaller picture and smaller file size. Depending on your camera, there may be different sizes available.


File size: This is the amount of space that the image file takes up on your memory card, or internal memory if your camera has one. It is measured in megabytes. The actual file size depends on the image size and image quality settings selected on the camera.


Image quality: This dictates how much compression is used to record the file information. Some digital cameras have a Fine and Standard setting where the Fine setting uses less compression than the Standard setting. Therefore, the detail of a picture taken with the Fine setting is a sharper than one taken with the Standard setting. Similar to the image size setting discussed above, this also affects the file size. Since the Fine setting uses less compression and records more detail, the file size will be larger than one recorded with the standard setting.
Compression is the process of reducing the size of a file. It is achieved by encoding the file in an efficient way, allowing it to be smaller.

If each pixel is defined using 8 bits of color information, then the file is eight times bigger than a black-and-white bitmap. Similarly, a 24-bit file is a full three times bigger than the 8-bit image, and a 48-bit file is twice the size of a 24-bit one.

Color depth is the number of colors that can be used for each pixel on the display. This can range from 8- bit color, 16-bit high color to 24-bit true color. The range of color is determined by how many bits of red, green and blue (RGB) each pixel is assigned to the frame buffer.

Saizi ya picha: Hii inawakilisha saizi ya mwili na azimio la picha iliyopimwa kwenye saizi. Kwa mfano, kamera 10 ya megapixel (mbunge) inaweza kutoa mipangilio ya kuchukua picha katika 10.2 mbunge (3872 x 2592), 5.6 mbunge (2896 x 1944), na mbunge 2.5 (1936 x 1296). Mpangilio wa saizi ya juu inamaanisha picha kubwa na saizi kubwa ya faili. Mpangilio wa saizi ya chini hufanya picha ndogo na saizi ndogo ya faili. Kulingana na kamera yako, kunaweza kuwa na saizi tofauti zinazopatikana.


Saizi ya Faili: Hii ni kiasi cha nafasi ambayo faili ya picha inachukua kwenye kadi yako ya kumbukumbu, au kumbukumbu ya ndani ikiwa kamera yako ina moja. Inapimwa katika megabytes. Saizi halisi ya faili inategemea saizi ya picha na mipangilio ya ubora wa picha iliyochaguliwa kwenye kamera.


Ubora wa picha: Hii inaamuru ni kiasi gani cha kushinikiza hutumiwa kurekodi habari ya faili. Kamera zingine za dijiti zina mpangilio mzuri na wa kawaida ambapo mpangilio mzuri hutumia compression kidogo kuliko mpangilio wa kawaida. Kwa hivyo, maelezo ya picha iliyochukuliwa na mpangilio mzuri ni nyembamba kuliko moja iliyochukuliwa na mpangilio wa kawaida. Sawa na mpangilio wa saizi ya picha iliyojadiliwa hapo juu, hii pia inaathiri saizi ya faili. Kwa kuwa mpangilio mzuri hutumia compression kidogo na rekodi ya undani zaidi, saizi ya faili itakuwa kubwa kuliko ile iliyorekodiwa na mpangilio wa kawaida.
Shinikiza ni mchakato wa kupunguza saizi ya faili. Inafanikiwa kwa kuingiza faili kwa njia bora, ikiruhusu iwe ndogo.

Ikiwa kila pixel inafafanuliwa kwa kutumia bits 8 za habari ya rangi, basi faili ni kubwa mara nane kuliko bitmap nyeusi-na-nyeupe. Vivyo hivyo, faili ya 24-bit ni kubwa mara tatu kuliko picha 8-bit, na faili 48-bit ni mara mbili saizi ya moja-24.

Kina cha rangi ni idadi ya rangi ambazo zinaweza kutumika kwa kila pixel kwenye onyesho. Hii inaweza kutoka kwa rangi 8- kidogo, rangi ya juu-16 hadi rangi ya kweli ya 24-bit. Aina ya rangi imedhamiriwa na bits ngapi za nyekundu, kijani na bluu (RGB) kila pixel imepewa buffer ya sura.

question_en: Why am I unstable on my bike when it's stationary but not when it's moving?
pos_context_title_en: Why Does A Moving Bicycle Stay Up? (www.science20.com)
Balancing on a Bicycle: The Phenomena (www.mentalfloss.com)
pos_context_en:
Since the bicycle was invented, s cientists have postulated various reasons as to why a bicycle is self stable above a certain speed. The consensus has been that a bicycle's stability is related to two factors: First, the rotating wheels of the bicycle provide stability through gyroscopic effects; secondly, that the ‘trail’, the distance by which the contact point of the front wheel trails behind the steering axis, plays an important part.

A new study in Science claims to have settled the issue - gyroscopic effects and trail help, says researcher Dr Arend Schwab of the 3mE faculty at TU Delft, but are not necessary above a certain speed . In a 2007 Proceedings of the Royal Society article (doi:10.1098/rspa.2007.1857), a mathematical model with around 25 physical parameters was developed at the time which appeared to predict whether, and at what speeds, a particular design of bicycle would be stable.

A bicycle, on the other hand, is statically unstable because it only has two contact points with the ground (whatever portion of the front and back wheels happen to be touching the ground) and its base of support is a line segment. A good base of support needs at least three contact points with the ground, so bikes are hard to keep upright when they're still. Bikes are, however, dynamically stable, or stable when moving forward, because steering allows a rider to move the bike's points of support around under the center of gravity and keep it balanced, often with steering adjustments small enough that the rider may not even realize they're making them. It's sort of like standing on one foot. If you don't hop around a little, and you start falling sideways, you can't recover and you fall over. If you do hop, though, you can move your foot around to keep your center of gravity above it and keep your balance.


A bike has two features that help this dynamic stability immensely: its wheels. Spinning wheels have angular momentum, and when you're sitting on a bike, you and it and its wheels make up a system that obeys the principle of conservation of angular momentum. Unless torque, or twisting force, is applied from outside the system to change the wheels' angular momentum, that momentum and the direction of the momentum remain constant. In a nutshell, once the wheels line up a certain way, they want to stay lined up like that. It's easy for you to move them, but hard for an outside force to do the same, and so the bike is easy to keep balanced but doesn't topple easily. A non-moving bike has wheels that aren't spinning and zero angular momentum, which makes it very easy for external torque to change the wheels' direction, making the bike harder to balance.
question_src: Kwa nini sina msimamo kwenye baiskeli yangu wakati ni ya stationary lakini sio wakati inasonga?
pos_context_title_src: Kwa nini baiskeli inayosonga inakaa? (www.science20.com)
Kusawazisha baiskeli: Matukio (www.mentalfloss.com)
pos_context_src:
Kwa kuwa baiskeli iligunduliwa, wahusika wakuu wameandika sababu tofauti za kwanini baiskeli imejiimarisha juu ya kasi fulani. Makubaliano yamekuwa kwamba utulivu wa baiskeli unahusiana na sababu mbili: kwanza, magurudumu yanayozunguka ya baiskeli hutoa utulivu kupitia athari za gyroscopic; Pili, kwamba 'uchaguzi', umbali ambao mahali pa mawasiliano ya gurudumu la mbele hufuata nyuma ya mhimili wa usukani, inachukua sehemu muhimu.

Utafiti mpya katika sayansi unadai kuwa umetatua suala hilo - athari za gyroscopic na msaada wa uchaguzi, anasema mtafiti Dk Arend Schwab wa kitivo cha 3ME huko TU Delft, lakini sio lazima juu ya kasi fulani. Katika kesi ya 2007 ya kifungu cha Royal Society (DOI: 10.1098/rspa.2007.1857), mfano wa kihesabu na vigezo 25 vya mwili vilitengenezwa wakati huo ambao ulionekana kutabiri ikiwa, na kwa kasi gani, muundo fulani wa baiskeli ungekuwa thabiti.

Baiskeli, kwa upande mwingine, haina msimamo kwa sababu ina sehemu mbili tu za mawasiliano na ardhi (sehemu yoyote ya magurudumu ya mbele na ya nyuma hufanyika kugusa ardhi) na msingi wake wa msaada ni sehemu ya mstari. Msingi mzuri wa msaada unahitaji angalau vituo vitatu vya mawasiliano na ardhi, kwa hivyo baiskeli ni ngumu kuweka wima wakati bado. Baiskeli ni, hata hivyo, ni thabiti, au ni thabiti wakati wa kusonga mbele, kwa sababu usukani huruhusu mpanda farasi kuhamisha sehemu za baiskeli za msaada karibu na katikati ya mvuto na kuiweka usawa, mara nyingi na marekebisho ya chini ya kutosha ambayo mpanda farasi anaweza hata kugundua kuwa wanayafanya. Ni aina ya kusimama kwa mguu mmoja. Ikiwa hautazunguka kidogo, na unaanza kuanguka kando, huwezi kupona na unaanguka. Ikiwa utashuka, ingawa, unaweza kusonga mguu wako kuzunguka ili kuweka kituo chako cha mvuto juu yake na kuweka usawa wako.


Baiskeli ina huduma mbili ambazo husaidia utulivu huu wa nguvu sana: magurudumu yake. Magurudumu ya Spinning yana kasi ya angular, na wakati umekaa baiskeli, wewe na IT na magurudumu yake hufanya mfumo ambao unatii kanuni ya uhifadhi wa kasi ya angular. Isipokuwa torque, au nguvu inayopotoka, inatumika kutoka nje ya mfumo kubadilisha kasi ya magurudumu, kasi hiyo na mwelekeo wa kasi hubaki kila wakati. Kwa kifupi, mara magurudumu yanaanzisha njia fulani, wanataka kukaa juu kama hiyo. Ni rahisi kwako kuwahamisha, lakini ni ngumu kwa nguvu ya nje kufanya vivyo hivyo, na kwa hivyo baiskeli ni rahisi kuweka usawa lakini haitoi kwa urahisi. Baiskeli isiyo na kusonga ina magurudumu ambayo hayana inazunguka na kasi ya angular, ambayo inafanya iwe rahisi sana kwa torque ya nje kubadilisha mwelekeo wa magurudumu, na kufanya baiskeli kuwa ngumu kusawazisha.

question_en: How were continents, countries and coastlines mapped out prior to the invention of satellites?
pos_context_title_en: How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
How did cartographers map out shores before modern times? (outdoors.stackexchange.com)
The Mystery of Extraordinarily Accurate Medieval Maps (www.discovermagazine.com)
pos_context_en:
"piloting". With piloting, you are determining your location using bearings from reference points on accurate maps. Here, we are using the bearing to objects to determine position of points along the coastline. Still, it works much the same way.


Maps - especially of shorelines - were almost certainly made from observations taken from boats. Naval navigation is much more accurate than navigation on land (especially without good maps!).

Prior to the mid-1700's, the primary means of navigation was dead reckoning (DR). This requires that you iteratively advance your position on the map from your last known position using direction and time/distance. Of course, over time, errors will compound resulting in reduced accuracy. You must have a way of measuring your direction of travel and a (somewhat) accurate value for your speed.


Later in the 1700's, it was possible to navigate more accurately using celestial navigation. This allowed a skilled navigator to determine his position rather accurately (typically within a few miles) at any point on the globe. The position was typically found once each day and advanced using DR as necessary.

The topics of navigation and cartography are two sides of the same coin, and there are entire books written about each. It is interesting to study the history of cartography because it very graphically shows the corresponding improvements in navigation over time.


In order to make an accurate map, you need to know first where you are making your observations from. Making the observations from a previously known position will result in much greater accuracy. This position may have been established by an earlier survey (eg, working from a known point on an existing map) or by being able to independently figure out your position with good certainty on the position of the globe.

The problem was the portolan mapmakers’ lack of a systematic way of reducing the spherical Earth to a flat map. That was of little consequence for short journeys but mattered much more when sailing longer distances. In 1569, the Belgian geographer and cartographer Gerardus Mercator created his method for presenting a spherical world on a flat map, the one familiar to us today. This mapmaking technique, though it stretched and compressed landmarks and distances between them, had the great advantage that a straight compass course was represented by a straight line on the map.


Mercator’s projections began to be used to sail the open seas by the early 1800s, by which time portolan charts had pretty much disappeared. But their importance is undeniable. “The development of these maps revolutionized how people perceived space, much like Google Earth has done in our lifetimes,” Hessler says. “Understanding how the technology was developed gives us insight into how we got here, and perhaps into where we’re going.”

"Kujaribu". Na marubani, unaamua eneo lako kwa kutumia fani kutoka kwa vidokezo vya kumbukumbu kwenye ramani sahihi. Hapa, tunatumia kuzaa kwa vitu kuamua msimamo wa alama kando ya ukingo wa pwani. Bado, inafanya kazi kwa njia ile ile.


Ramani - haswa za pwani - karibu zilifanywa kutoka kwa uchunguzi uliochukuliwa kutoka kwa boti. Urambazaji wa majini ni sahihi zaidi kuliko urambazaji kwenye ardhi (haswa bila ramani nzuri!).

Kabla ya katikati ya miaka ya 1700, njia za msingi za urambazaji zilikuwa Dead Reckoning (DR). Hii inahitaji kuendeleza msimamo wako kwenye ramani kutoka kwa nafasi yako ya mwisho inayojulikana kwa kutumia mwelekeo na wakati/umbali. Kwa kweli, baada ya muda, makosa yatasababisha kusababisha usahihi wa kupunguzwa. Lazima uwe na njia ya kupima mwelekeo wako wa kusafiri na (kiasi fulani) thamani sahihi kwa kasi yako.


Baadaye katika miaka ya 1700, iliwezekana kuzunguka kwa usahihi zaidi kwa kutumia urambazaji wa mbinguni. Hii iliruhusu navigator mwenye ujuzi kuamua msimamo wake badala ya usahihi (kawaida ndani ya maili chache) wakati wowote kwenye ulimwengu. Nafasi hiyo ilipatikana mara moja kila siku na ya juu kwa kutumia DR kama inahitajika.

Mada za urambazaji na katuni ni pande mbili za sarafu moja, na kuna vitabu vyote vilivyoandikwa juu ya kila moja. Inafurahisha kusoma historia ya katuni kwa sababu inaonyesha sana maboresho yanayolingana katika urambazaji kwa wakati.


Ili kutengeneza ramani sahihi, unahitaji kujua kwanza ambapo unafanya uchunguzi wako kutoka. Kufanya uchunguzi kutoka kwa msimamo unaojulikana hapo awali utasababisha usahihi zaidi. Nafasi hii inaweza kuwa imeanzishwa na uchunguzi wa mapema (kwa mfano, kufanya kazi kutoka kwa hatua inayojulikana kwenye ramani iliyopo) au kwa kuweza kujua kwa uhuru msimamo wako kwa uhakika mzuri juu ya msimamo wa ulimwengu.

Shida ilikuwa ukosefu wa ramani ya Portolan 'ya njia ya utaratibu wa kupunguza ardhi ya spherical kuwa ramani ya gorofa. Hiyo haikuwa na matokeo kidogo kwa safari fupi lakini ilikuwa na maana zaidi wakati wa kusafiri umbali mrefu zaidi. Mnamo 1569, jiografia ya Ubelgiji na mwandishi wa katuni Gerardus Mercator aliunda njia yake ya kuwasilisha ulimwengu wa spherical kwenye ramani ya gorofa, ile inayojulikana kwetu leo. Mbinu hii ya kutengeneza ramani, ingawa ilinyoosha na kushinikiza alama na umbali kati yao, ilikuwa na faida kubwa kwamba kozi ya moja kwa moja ya dira iliwakilishwa na mstari wa moja kwa moja kwenye ramani.


Makadirio ya Mercator yakaanza kutumika kusafiri kwa bahari wazi mapema miaka ya 1800, wakati huo chati za Portolan zilikuwa zimepotea sana. Lakini umuhimu wao hauwezekani. "Ukuzaji wa ramani hizi ulibadilisha jinsi watu walivyogundua nafasi, kama vile Google Earth imefanya katika maisha yetu," Hessler anasema. "Kuelewa jinsi teknolojia ilivyotengenezwa inatupa ufahamu juu ya jinsi tulivyofika hapa, na labda mahali tunapoenda."

question_en: Why is wearing a swastika considered taboo but every biker I see wears an iron cross on his shirt, jacket, skin or motorcycle?
pos_context_title_en: Swastika (en.wikipedia.org)
History of the Swastika (encyclopedia.ushmm.org)
Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
Iron Cross (www.adl.org)
pos_context_en: In the Western world, it was a symbol of auspiciousness and good luck until the 1930s[4] when the right-facing tilted form became a feature of Nazi symbolism as an emblem of the Aryan race. As a result of World War II and the Holocaust, many people in the West still strongly associate it with Nazism and antisemitism.

The Nazi Party was not the only party to use the swastika in Germany. After World War I, a number of far-right nationalist movements adopted the swastika. As a symbol, it became associated with the idea of a racially “pure” state. By the time the Nazis gained control of Germany, the connotations of the swastika had forever changed.

The Iron Cross is a famous German military medal dating back to the 19th century. During the 1930s, the Nazi regime in Germany superimposed a swastika on the traditional medal, turning it into a Nazi symbol. After World War II, the medal was discontinued but neo-Nazis and other white supremacists subsequently adopted it as a hate symbol and it has been a commonly-used hate symbol ever since.

In the United States, however, the Iron Cross also became one of several Nazi-era symbols adopted by outlaw bikers, more to signify rebellion or to shock than for any white supremacist ideology. By the early 2000s, this other use of the Iron Cross had spread from bikers to skateboarders and many extreme sports enthusiasts and became part of the logo of several different companies producing equipment and clothing for this audience. Consequently, the use of the Iron Cross in a non-racist context has greatly proliferated in the United States, to the point that an Iron Cross in isolation (i.e., without a superimposed swastika or without other accompanying hate symbols) cannot be determined to be a hate symbol.

Kama matokeo ya Vita vya Kidunia vya pili na Holocaust, watu wengi huko Magharibi bado wanaiunganisha kwa nguvu na Nazism na antisemitism.

Chama cha Nazi haikuwa chama pekee cha kutumia swastika huko Ujerumani. Baada ya Vita vya Kwanza vya Ulimwengu, idadi ya harakati za kitaifa za kulia zilipitisha Swastika. Kama ishara, ilihusishwa na wazo la hali ya "safi". Kufikia wakati Wanazi walipata udhibiti wa Ujerumani, maelewano ya swastika yalikuwa yamebadilika milele.

Iron Cross ni medali maarufu ya kijeshi ya Ujerumani iliyoanzia karne ya 19. Wakati wa miaka ya 1930, serikali ya Nazi huko Ujerumani ilizidisha swastika kwenye medali ya jadi, na kuibadilisha kuwa ishara ya Nazi. Baada ya Vita vya Kidunia vya pili, medali hiyo ilikataliwa lakini Neo-Nazi na wakuu wengine wazungu waliipitisha kama ishara ya chuki na imekuwa ishara ya chuki ya kawaida tangu hapo.

Huko Merika, hata hivyo, Cross ya Iron pia ikawa moja ya alama kadhaa za Nazi-era zilizopitishwa na baiskeli za sheria, zaidi kuashiria uasi au mshtuko kuliko kwa itikadi yoyote ya juu ya supremacist. Kufikia miaka ya 2000 mapema, matumizi haya mengine ya Cross ya Iron yalikuwa yameenea kutoka kwa baiskeli hadi skateboarders na washiriki wengi wa michezo uliokithiri na ikawa sehemu ya nembo ya kampuni kadhaa tofauti zinazozalisha vifaa na mavazi kwa hadhira hii. Kwa hivyo, utumiaji wa msalaba wa chuma katika muktadha usio wa ubaguzi wa rangi umeenea sana huko Merika, hadi kufikia kwamba msalaba wa chuma uliotengwa (i.e., bila swastika iliyo wazi au bila alama zingine za chuki) haziwezi kuamua kuwa ishara ya chuki.

pos_context_en: CRISPR stands for “clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats.”
This CRISPR/Cas9 tool was first described in 2012 and 2013. Science labs around the world soon started using it to alter an organism’s genome — the entire set of its DNA instructions.

This tool can quickly and efficiently tweak almost any gene in any plant or animal. Researchers already have used it to fix genetic diseases in animals, to combat viruses and to sterilize mosquitoes. They have also used it to prepare pig organs for human transplants and to beef up the muscles in beagles.

Crispr might be new, but the key points of our conversation were hardly original. We focused on the scientists’ concerns—regulatory uncertainties, access to research funding, intellectual property ownership—and on the government officials’ concerns—national security and public backlash to engineered “designer babies.” The same conversation happened in 1991 when the first gene therapy trials started on humans, and again in 1996 with the birth of Dolly, a cloned sheep. A few years later, in 2003, the sequencing of the first human genome raised the same concerns. The questions were always narrow and reductive, in part because those asking the questions only imagined a future in which we cut, copied, and pasted existing genetic material. They failed to see a future in which anyone could create life from scratch.

It was. Zhang’s work demonstrated that CRISPR could be used to precisely and efficiently edit the DNA of human cells. And with that, the revolution was under way.


Today you can go online to any number of biological-supply companies and order your own CRISPR kit for as little as $130.

Chombo hiki kinaweza haraka na kwa ufanisi karibu na jeni yoyote katika mmea wowote au mnyama. Watafiti tayari wameitumia kurekebisha magonjwa ya maumbile katika wanyama, kupambana na virusi na kutuliza mbu. Pia wameitumia kuandaa viungo vya nguruwe kwa kupandikiza kwa binadamu na kuokota misuli kwenye beagles.

CRISPR inaweza kuwa mpya, lakini mambo muhimu ya mazungumzo yetu hayakuwa ya asili. Tulizingatia wasiwasi wa wanasayansi - kutokuwa na uhakika wa kisheria, upatikanaji wa utafiti wa fedha, umiliki wa miliki -na juu ya wasiwasi wa maafisa wa serikali - usalama wa kitaifa na kurudi nyuma kwa umma kwa "watoto wabuni." Mazungumzo kama hayo yalitokea mnamo 1991 wakati majaribio ya tiba ya kwanza ya jeni yalipoanza kwa wanadamu, na tena mnamo 1996 na kuzaliwa kwa Dolly, kondoo aliyefungwa. Miaka michache baadaye, mnamo 2003, mpangilio wa genome la kwanza la mwanadamu ulizua wasiwasi huo. Maswali yalikuwa nyembamba na ya kupunguza, kwa sehemu kwa sababu wale wanaouliza maswali walifikiria tu siku zijazo ambazo tulikata, kunakili, na kubandika vifaa vya maumbile vilivyopo. Walishindwa kuona siku zijazo ambazo mtu yeyote anaweza kuunda maisha kutoka mwanzo.

Ilikuwa. Kazi ya Zhang ilionyesha kuwa CRISPR inaweza kutumika kwa usahihi na kwa ufanisi kuhariri DNA ya seli za binadamu. Na kwa hiyo, mapinduzi yalikuwa yanaendelea.


Leo unaweza kwenda mkondoni kwa idadi yoyote ya kampuni za usambazaji wa kibaolojia na kuagiza kitengo chako cha CRISPR kwa kidogo kama $ 130.

question_en: Year counting in ancient Greece
pos_context_title_en: The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
The Ancient Greek Calendar | Polysyllabic (www.polysyllabic.com)
pos_context_en:
The Athenians seem to have taken a rather casual attitude towards their calendar. It appears they used neither a regular formula nor continuous direct observation to determine the length of the months. Most likely, they followed a general rule of alternating months (29 and 30 days long), subject to periodic correction by observation.

In addition to this calendar, which has been called the festival calendar, Athenians maintained a second calendar for the political year. This "conciliar" year divided the year into "prytanies," one for each of the "phylai," the subdivisions of Athenian citizens. The number of phylai, and hence the number of prytanies, varies over time. Until 307 BCE, there were 10 phylai.

After that the number varies between 11 and 13 (usually 12). Even more confusing, while the conciliar and festival years were basically the same length in the 4th century BCE, such was not regularly the case earlier or later. Thus documents dated by prytany are frequently very difficult to assign to a particular equivalent in the Julian calendar, although we are usually secure in assigning an approximate date

Ancient historians date by Olympiad by giving both the number of the Olympiad and the year within the cycle, 1-4 (the Olympiad itself was held on year 1). Additionally, lists of Olympic winners were maintained, and the 3rd c. BCE writer Timaios compiled a synchronic list comparing Olympic winners, Athenian archons, Spartan kings, and the priests of Hera from Argos.

Olympiad 1,1 correlates to 776 BCE. We do not actually need to believe an actual festival was held on this date, but when Greek historians are writing in later times, they date their own events using this as the epoch. We can establish a precise correlation to the common era from a variety of different sources, but the most definitive comes from a passage in Diodorus, where he dates the year of a total solar eclipse to the reign of the Athenian archon Hieromnemon, which he also gives as Ol. 117,3. The only astronomically possible date for this event is August 15, 310 BCE, which fixes our epoch

pos_context_en: In the timeline of these two formats, aux came first, in the 1960s. It’s an analogue medium, meaning it can only transmit sound. In addition to this aux cables are made of copper, and the data transmitted through it do so via the continuous waveform of electrical information.

The main difference between a USB (Universal Serial Bus) connection and an auxiliary input is that USB cords send digital information while aux cables send analog signals. USB cords transfer data as you would to a computer, while aux cables transmit audio as you would to an amplifier or pair of headphones.

At the most basic level, an earphone is a loop of wire with current running through it. This electric current in the loop then interacts with a permanent magnet which in turn pushes the air---that's sound.

question_en: Why don't general physicians cover teeth?
pos_context_title_en: The Reason Your Dental Work Isn't Covered by Medical Insurance (www.nbcnews.com)
Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
Why Doesn’t Health Insurance Cover Dental and Vision, Too? (melmagazine.com)
pos_context_en:
We may have since greatly evolved in how we regard and understand dentistry, but we haven’t embraced it as a primarily medical issue; if we had, it would be covered under medical insurance, or at least, things like a root canal would be, because if you need a root canal and don’t get one, you could end up with all kinds of lethal problems that lead to hospitalization. It is rumored that Queen Elizabeth died from blood poisoning as a result of an untreated tooth infection. That was a long time ago, but hey, it happens.

Why isn’t a health problem so serious it can be deadly, not considered medical? To an extent, it’s because it’s not that common to end up in the hospital as a result of a tooth or gum problem — not if you’re keeping up with preventative dental care.

That aside, one of the main reasons why our eyes and teeth are ignored by most health-care plans has to do with history and stigma. For one, dentistry and medicine have long been considered to be distinctly different practices. Until the 1800s, barbers served as unsophisticated dentists, pulling teeth and piercing abscesses after giving you a nice, close shave. As time went on, dentistry (and ophthalmology, to some degree) was regarded as less advanced than medicine, which seeped into the minds of Congress while they formulated public health insurance policies in the 1960s. As just one example of the general sentiment during those times, in 1940, an appellate court in New York decided that dentists weren’t doctors, and thus not deserving of the same prestige.

This same stigma has also led to a perception that dental and vision problems are perhaps less serious than “medical” ones, and therefore should be kept separate. (Some people may also mistakenly feel like dental problems are a personal problem that has to do with your own lapses in dental hygiene, whereas medical problems can affect everyone.) But this is a questionable stance: More than 50,000 people will be diagnosed with oral cancer this year. Research has demonstrated links between periodontal infections and chronic conditions, like diabetes and cardiovascular disease. Surely, tons of people end up in the ER because of accidents caused by them not being able to see well enough. And what about all the people who lose out on opportunities because they have a missing tooth?

pos_context_src:
Tunaweza kuwa tumetokea sana katika jinsi tunavyozingatia na kuelewa meno, lakini hatujakumbatia kama suala la matibabu; Ikiwa tungekuwa na, ingefunikwa chini ya bima ya matibabu, au angalau, vitu kama mfereji wa mizizi vitakuwa, kwa sababu ikiwa unahitaji mfereji wa mizizi na haupati moja, unaweza kuishia na kila aina ya shida zinazosababisha kulazwa hospitalini. Ni uvumi kwamba Malkia Elizabeth alikufa kutokana na sumu ya damu kwa sababu ya maambukizo ya jino yasiyotibiwa. Hiyo ilikuwa ni muda mrefu uliopita, lakini hey, hufanyika.

Je! Kwa nini sio shida ya kiafya kuwa mbaya sana inaweza kuwa mbaya, haizingatiwi matibabu? Kwa kiwango, ni kwa sababu sio kawaida kuishia hospitalini kwa sababu ya shida ya jino au ufizi - sio ikiwa unaendelea na utunzaji wa meno ya kuzuia.

Kwamba kando, moja ya sababu kuu kwa nini macho yetu na meno hayazingatiwi na mipango mingi ya utunzaji wa afya inahusiana na historia na unyanyapaa. Kwa moja, meno na dawa zimezingatiwa kuwa mazoea tofauti tofauti. Hadi miaka ya 1800, wanyonyaji walitumikia kama madaktari wa meno wasio na sifa, wakivuta meno na kutoboa vitunguu baada ya kukupa kunyoa nzuri, ya karibu. Kadri muda ulivyoendelea, meno (na ophthalmology, kwa kiwango fulani) ilizingatiwa kuwa ya juu zaidi kuliko dawa, ambayo iliingia kwenye akili za Congress wakati waliunda sera za bima ya afya ya umma mnamo 1960. Kama mfano mmoja tu wa maoni ya jumla wakati huo, mnamo 1940, mahakama ya rufaa huko New York iliamua kwamba madaktari wa meno hawakuwa madaktari, na kwa hivyo hawastahili ufahari huo.

Unyanyapaa huo pia umesababisha maoni kwamba shida za meno na maono labda sio kubwa kuliko zile za "matibabu", na kwa hivyo zinapaswa kuwekwa tofauti. (Watu wengine wanaweza pia kuhisi vibaya kama shida za meno ni shida ya kibinafsi ambayo inahusiana na upungufu wako mwenyewe katika usafi wa meno, wakati shida za matibabu zinaweza kuathiri kila mtu.) Lakini hii ni msimamo usio na shaka: zaidi ya watu 50,000 watagunduliwa na saratani ya mdomo mwaka huu. Utafiti umeonyesha viungo kati ya maambukizo ya muda na hali sugu, kama ugonjwa wa sukari na ugonjwa wa moyo na mishipa. Hakika, tani za watu huishia kwenye ER kwa sababu ya ajali zinazosababishwa na wao kutokuwa na uwezo wa kuona vya kutosha. Na nini juu ya watu wote ambao hupoteza fursa kwa sababu wana jino lililokosekana?

pos_context_en: The rate of wrongful convictions in the United States is estimated to be somewhere between 2 percent and 10 percent. That may sound low, but when applied to an estimated prison population of 2.3 million, the numbers become staggering. Can there really be 46,000 to 230,000 innocent people locked away? Those of us who are involved in exoneration work firmly believe so.

Bad police work. Most cops are honest, hard-working professionals. But some have been known to hide, alter or fabricate evidence; lie on the stand; cut deals in return for bogus testimony; intimidate and threaten witnesses; coerce confessions; or manipulate eyewitness identifications.

Prosecutorial misconduct. Most prosecutors are also honest, hard-working professionals. But some have been known to hide exculpatory evidence; encourage witnesses to commit perjury; lie to jurors, judges and defense lawyers; use the testimony of bogus experts; or ignore relevant evidence beneficial to the accused.

False confessions. Most jurors find it impossible to believe that a suspect would confess to a serious crime he didn't commit. Yet the average citizen, if taken to a basement room and subjected to 10 consecutive hours of abusive interrogation tactics by experienced cops, might be surprised at what they would say. Of the 330 people who were exonerated by DNA evidence between 1989 to 2015, about 25 percent gave bogus confessions after lengthy interrogations

question_en: Scientifically speaking , how likely is it that our existence is extremely small?
pos_context_title_en: Rare Earth hypothesis (en.wikipedia.org)
pos_context_en: The Rare Earth hypothesis argues that the evolution of biological complexity anywhere in the universe requires the coincidence of a large number of fortuitous circumstances, including, among others, a galactic habitable zone; a central star and planetary system having the requisite character (i.e. a circumstellar habitable zone); a terrestrial planet of the right mass; the advantage of one or more gas giant guardians like Jupiter and possibly a large natural satellite to shield the planet from frequent impact events; conditions needed to ensure the planet has a magnetosphere and plate tectonics; a chemistry similar to that present in the Earth's lithosphere, atmosphere, and oceans; the influence of periodic "evolutionary pumps" such as massive glaciations and bolide impacts; and whatever factors may have led to the emergence of eukaryotic cells, sexual reproduction, and the Cambrian explosion of animal, plant, and fungi phyla. The evolution of human beings and of human intelligence may have required yet further specific events and circumstances, all of which are extremely unlikely to have happened

question_en: How do birds know which way is South when migrating for winter?
pos_context_title_en: How Do Birds Know Which Way is South? (www.wonderopolis.org)
How Do Birds Navigate? (www.nationalgeographic.org)
How do migratory birds find their way ? - News - EducaPoles (www.educapoles.org)
pos_context_en:
One thing birds definitely rely upon is the Sun. The Sun rises in the east and sets in the west. Birds flying south for the winter can stay on track by using the Sun's position in the sky throughout the day as a guide.


Of course, once the Sun sets, it isn't much help as a guide. Luckily, many birds can also navigate by the position of the stars in the sky once night rolls around. Constellations guided many sailors at night before modern technology came along. Birds can use the stars as navigational aids in the same way.


Birds also have the benefit of a bird's eye view. Human hikers lost in the woods sometimes must climb to the top of the nearest mountain to be able to see natural or man-made landscape features, like roads or coastlines, to find their way home. Birds just take to the sky where they get an awesome view of everything below them. Sometimes traveling south is as simple as following the path of a river that travels south to warmer temperatures.


Finally, some scientists believe some birds may also get some of their guidance from Earth's magnetic field. Some species of birds have a highly-magnetic mineral called magnetite in their brains. Experts believe this mineral may help birds detect Earth's magnetic field and use it to guide them south.

The flight paths used by birds in their annual migrations are called flyway s.


Scientists are not entirely sure how birds navigate their flyways. They seem to have an internal global positioning system (GPS) that allows them to follow the same pattern every year. A young bird imprint s on the sun and stars to help orient it. Some researchers think a bird may also recognize landmark s.


Individual organ s also contribute to a bird’s remarkable navigational ability. A bird’s eyes interact with its brain in a region called “cluster N”, which probably helps the bird determine which way is north. Tiny amounts of iron in the neurons of a bird’s inner ear also help in this determination.

nother tool is the earth's magnetic field (earth's north and south magnetic poles). Some birds, like pigeons, have a small zone in their brain made of magnetite (magnetic mineral), just like a small compass. But other scientists think it's rather in their eyes that some birds have a system which indicates them where the magnetic north is...


Of course, birds also use their knowledge of the landscape: they follow rivers, valleys or roads, or locate themselves with particular mountain peaks.


Other tracks are still to be explored. For example it seems that some birds could find their way by following their sense of smell...

pos_context_src:
Jambo moja ndege hutegemea ni Jua. Jua linachomoza mashariki na huweka magharibi. Ndege zinazoruka kusini kwa msimu wa baridi zinaweza kukaa kwenye wimbo kwa kutumia nafasi ya jua angani siku nzima kama mwongozo.


Kwa kweli, jua linapochomoza, sio msaada sana kama mwongozo. Kwa bahati nzuri, ndege wengi wanaweza pia kuzunguka kwa msimamo wa nyota angani mara moja usiku unazunguka. Constellations ziliongoza mabaharia wengi usiku kabla ya teknolojia ya kisasa kuja. Ndege zinaweza kutumia nyota kama misaada ya majini kwa njia ile ile.


Ndege pia zina faida ya mtazamo wa jicho la ndege. Watekaji wa kibinadamu waliopotea msituni wakati mwingine lazima wapanda juu ya mlima wa karibu ili kuweza kuona sura za mazingira au za mwanadamu, kama barabara au pwani, kupata njia yao ya kurudi nyumbani. Ndege huchukua tu angani ambapo wanapata mtazamo mzuri wa kila kitu chini yao. Wakati mwingine kusafiri kusini ni rahisi kama kufuata njia ya mto ambao husafiri kusini kwa joto la joto.


Mwishowe, wanasayansi wengine wanaamini ndege wengine wanaweza pia kupata mwongozo wao kutoka kwa sumaku ya Dunia. Aina zingine za ndege zina madini ya sumaku inayoitwa magnetite kwenye akili zao. Wataalam wanaamini madini haya yanaweza kusaidia ndege kugundua sumaku ya Dunia na kuitumia kuwaongoza kusini.

Njia za kukimbia zinazotumiwa na ndege katika uhamiaji wao wa kila mwaka huitwa Flyway S.


Wanasayansi hawana uhakika kabisa jinsi ndege wanavyozunguka njia zao za kuruka. Wanaonekana kuwa na mfumo wa ndani wa nafasi ya ulimwengu (GPS) ambayo inawaruhusu kufuata muundo huo kila mwaka. Ndege mchanga huingiza jua na nyota kusaidia kuielekeza. Watafiti wengine wanafikiria ndege inaweza pia kutambua alama ya alama.


Kiungo cha mtu binafsi pia kinachangia uwezo wa ajabu wa ndege wa ndege. Macho ya ndege huingiliana na ubongo wake katika mkoa unaoitwa "nguzo N", ambayo labda husaidia ndege kuamua ni njia gani kaskazini. Kiasi kidogo cha chuma katika neurons ya sikio la ndani la ndege pia husaidia katika uamuzi huu.

Chombo cha Nother ni uwanja wa sumaku wa Dunia (miti ya kaskazini ya kaskazini na kusini). Ndege wengine, kama njiwa, wana eneo ndogo katika ubongo wao uliotengenezwa na sumaku (madini ya madini), kama dira ndogo. Lakini wanasayansi wengine wanafikiria ni machoni mwao kwamba ndege wengine wana mfumo ambao unawaonyesha ambapo kaskazini ya sumaku iko ...


Kwa kweli, ndege pia hutumia ufahamu wao wa mazingira: wanafuata mito, mabonde au barabara, au hujikuta na kilele fulani cha mlima.


Nyimbo zingine bado zinapaswa kuchunguzwa. Kwa mfano inaonekana kwamba ndege wengine wanaweza kupata njia yao kwa kufuata hisia zao za harufu ...

question_en: How are rare, valuable, irreplaceable museum artifacts transported?
pos_context_title_en: Valuable artefacts from Egypt transported to Prague’s National Museum (english.radio.cz)
Artifact Loan Procedures and Requirements (airandspace.si.edu)
Artifact Loan Procedures and Requirements (airandspace.si.edu)
How Do Museums Move Artifacts? - Square Cow Moovers (squarecowmovers.com)
How Do Museums Move Artifacts? - Square Cow Moovers (squarecowmovers.com)
pos_context_en: Dozens of artefacts discovered by Czech archaeologists in Egypt’s Abusir have been transported under strict security measures to the National Museum in Prague.

All transportation (carrier, customs brokerage, freight forwarding, additional security, storage, travel between venues, etc.) associated with transit from and to NASM, and between venues, must be approved by NASM, with all costs borne by the Borrower. The use of an approved customs brokerage firm is required to coordinate the shipping of all international loans and may be required for certain domestic loans.

If a courier is required, the Borrower will be responsible for all courier costs and any and all unforeseen expenditures required to assure the safe transport and installation of the lent artifacts as well as the transport of the courier. NASM retains the right to require that a loan be accompanied by a NASM staff courier (or outside contracted individual) and that unpacking, mounting, installation, de-installation, and repacking be supervised by the courier at the Borrower’s expense. Types of lent artifacts that generally require the aid of a courier include, but are not limited, to those possessing unique conservation concerns (such as spacesuits), highly fragile artifacts, artifacts that require specialized knowledge for installation or handling, and artifacts with high monetary or scholarly values. In addition to a courier, certain high value artifacts may require the use of specialized security escorts during transit.

The short answer to the question in the title is – very, very carefully. Since exhibitions frequently change, museums have to transport a lot of precious, culturally important items. In addition to being priceless artifacts, many museum pieces are extremely delicate and don’t fit in a standard packing box. Moving any type of artifact is a massive undertaking that requires multiple moving experts.

Moisture is the biggest cause of weather damage to artifacts. The slightest bit of humidity can damage items made of plant and animal materials. If the relative humidity is off it can also increase the chance of mildew and microbial growth.


Temperature is also a concern. Extreme cold and hot temperatures could compromise some items. Moving in the spring or fall is a preferred time in some areas since the weather is usually more temperate. The ideal temperature for many artifacts is 65 degrees Fahrenheit.


Climate has to be controlled at every stage, including short-term storage. If the truck containing the piece isn’t insulated during transport, consider how it can be packaged to provide extra insulation. Moving blankets are an excellent way to provide extra padding and insulation.


### Give Items Plenty of Space


Packing strategically is important anytime you move, but for museum quality pieces ample space is often needed. Instead of cramming everything in together like sardines to save space, heirlooms, artifacts and artwork may actually benefit from extra space.


If there’s any chance that friction or contact could damage a museum piece it’s placed in a crate or special packaging. Museums have even had to construct mounts, trays and supports to stabilize artifacts before they’re moved. When that’s not possible, the item is adequately secured in place and given plenty of room in the moving truck.


### Special Packaging for Documents


Even the documentation that authenticates a historical artifact or art piece is a vital item that has to be handled and packed with care. When you’re moving files moisture is again a top concern, but physical damage can also easily occur if documents aren’t packaged appropriately.


File boxes are designed to securely hold thousands of letter or legal size documents. File folders can also be used in the boxes to keep documents in order without causing any damage.

pos_context_src: Sanaa kadhaa za sanaa zilizogunduliwa na wanaakiolojia wa Czech huko Abusir ya Misri zimesafirishwa chini ya hatua kali za usalama kwenda kwenye Jumba la Makumbusho ya Kitaifa huko Prague.

Usafirishaji wote (mchukuaji, udalali wa forodha, usambazaji wa mizigo, usalama wa ziada, uhifadhi, kusafiri kati ya kumbi, nk) zinazohusiana na usafirishaji kutoka na kwa NASM, na kati ya kumbi, lazima ziidhinishwe na NASM, na gharama zote zilizochukuliwa na akopaye. Matumizi ya kampuni iliyoidhinishwa ya udalali wa forodha inahitajika kuratibu usafirishaji wa mikopo yote ya kimataifa na inaweza kuhitajika kwa mikopo fulani ya nyumbani.

Ikiwa mjumbe anahitajika, akopaye atawajibika kwa gharama zote za mjumbe na matumizi yoyote yasiyotarajiwa yanahitajika kuhakikisha usafirishaji salama na usanikishaji wa mabaki ya Lent pamoja na usafirishaji wa mjumbe. NASM inakuwa na haki ya kuhitaji kwamba mkopo uambatane na mjumbe wa wafanyikazi wa NASM (au mtu wa nje aliye na mkataba) na kwamba kufunguliwa, kuweka, ufungaji, kusanikisha, na kurudisha tena kusimamiwa na mjumbe kwa gharama ya akopaye. Aina za mabaki ya Lent ambayo kwa ujumla yanahitaji msaada wa mjumbe ni pamoja na, lakini sio mdogo, kwa wale walio na wasiwasi wa kipekee wa uhifadhi (kama spacesuits), mabaki dhaifu, mabaki ambayo yanahitaji maarifa maalum kwa usanikishaji au utunzaji, na mabaki yenye maadili ya juu au ya kitaalam. Mbali na mjumbe, bandia fulani za juu zinaweza kuhitaji matumizi ya kusindikiza usalama wakati wa usafirishaji.

Jibu fupi kwa swali katika kichwa ni - sana, kwa uangalifu sana. Kwa kuwa maonyesho hubadilika mara kwa mara, makumbusho yanapaswa kusafirisha vitu vingi vya thamani, vya kitamaduni. Mbali na kuwa mabaki ya thamani, vipande vingi vya makumbusho ni dhaifu sana na havifai kwenye sanduku la kawaida la kufunga. Kuhamisha aina yoyote ya bandia ni ahadi kubwa ambayo inahitaji wataalam wengi wa kusonga mbele.

Unyevu ndio sababu kubwa ya uharibifu wa hali ya hewa kwa mabaki. Kidogo kidogo cha unyevu kinaweza kuharibu vitu vilivyotengenezwa kwa vifaa vya mmea na wanyama. Ikiwa unyevu wa jamaa uko mbali inaweza pia kuongeza nafasi ya ukuaji wa koga na ukuaji wa microbial.


Joto pia ni wasiwasi. Joto kali na joto kali linaweza kuathiri vitu kadhaa. Kuhamia katika chemchemi au kuanguka ni wakati unaopendelea katika maeneo mengine kwani hali ya hewa kawaida huwa na joto zaidi. Joto bora kwa mabaki mengi ni nyuzi 65 Fahrenheit.


Hali ya hewa lazima kudhibitiwa katika kila hatua, pamoja na uhifadhi wa muda mfupi. Ikiwa lori lililo na kipande hicho halina maboksi wakati wa usafirishaji, fikiria jinsi inaweza kusanikishwa ili kutoa insulation ya ziada. Kusonga blanketi ni njia bora ya kutoa pedi za ziada na insulation.


####Toa vitu vingi vya nafasi


Kufunga kimkakati ni muhimu wakati wowote unapohama, lakini kwa vipande vya ubora wa makumbusho nafasi ya kutosha mara nyingi inahitajika. Badala ya kukanyaga kila kitu pamoja kama sardine kuokoa nafasi, heirlooms, mabaki na sanaa ya sanaa inaweza kufaidika na nafasi ya ziada.


Ikiwa kuna nafasi yoyote kwamba msuguano au mawasiliano yanaweza kuharibu kipande cha makumbusho kilichowekwa kwenye crate au ufungaji maalum. Makumbusho hata ilibidi kuunda milipuko, trays na msaada ili kuleta utulivu wa mabaki kabla ya kuhamishwa. Wakati hiyo haiwezekani, bidhaa hiyo imehifadhiwa vya kutosha mahali na kupewa nafasi nyingi kwenye lori inayosonga.


####Ufungaji maalum kwa hati


Hata nyaraka ambazo zinathibitisha sanaa ya kihistoria au kipande cha sanaa ni kitu muhimu ambacho kinapaswa kushughulikiwa na kubeba kwa uangalifu. Unapohamisha unyevu wa faili tena ni wasiwasi wa juu, lakini uharibifu wa mwili pia unaweza kutokea kwa urahisi ikiwa hati hazijafungwa ipasavyo.


Masanduku ya faili yameundwa kushikilia salama maelfu ya barua au hati za ukubwa wa kisheria. Folda za faili pia zinaweza kutumika kwenye sanduku kuweka hati ili bila kusababisha uharibifu wowote.

question_en: How UPS drivers save gas by avioding left turns.
pos_context_title_en: ORION: The algorithm proving that left isn't right | UPS (www.ups.com)
Why UPS trucks (almost) never turn left (www.cnn.com)
The Science Behind Why UPS Trucks Avoid Making Left Turns (bigthink.com)
pos_context_en: Left turns mean idling, which increases the time a route takes. Left turns mean going against traffic, which increases exposure to oncoming cars. Right turns are faster. Right turns save fuel.
Left turns are also three times more likely to kill pedestrians than right ones, according to data collected by New York City’s transportation planners.

By keeping left-hand turns to a minimum, UPS says it's saved 10 million gallons of fuel, avoided the emission of 20,000 tons of CO2, and delivered 350,000 more packages a year. UPS senior vice president Bob Stoffel told Fortune, “We'll never have a person turn left to deliver on that side. We'll have someone go down the right-hand side and someone coming back down the right-hand side to avoid those left-hand turns. And that's where you get stuck in traffic trying to come back across."

Sayansi nyuma ya kwanini malori ya UPS huepuka kufanya zamu za kushoto (bigthink.com)
pos_context_src: Zamu za kushoto zinamaanisha idling, ambayo huongeza wakati njia inachukua. Zamu ya kushoto inamaanisha kwenda dhidi ya trafiki, ambayo huongeza mfiduo kwa magari yanayokuja. Zamu za kulia ni haraka. Zamu za kulia Hifadhi mafuta.
Zamu za kushoto pia zina uwezekano wa kuua watembea kwa miguu kuliko zile za kulia, kulingana na data iliyokusanywa na wapangaji wa usafirishaji wa Jiji la New York.

Kwa kuweka zamu ya kushoto kwa kiwango cha chini, UPS inasema imeokolewa galoni milioni 10 za mafuta, ilizuia utoaji wa tani 20,000 za CO2, na kutoa vifurushi zaidi ya 350,000 kwa mwaka. Makamu wa rais mwandamizi wa UPS Bob Stoffel aliiambia Bahati, "Hatutawahi kuwa na mtu ageuke kushoto kwa upande huo. Tutakuwa na mtu aende upande wa kulia na mtu akirudi upande wa kulia ili kuepusha zamu hizo za kushoto. Na hapo ndipo unapokuwa umekwama kwenye trafiki kujaribu kurudi."

question_en: What is the "Model Minority"?
pos_context_title_en: The Model Minority Myth | The Practice (thepractice.law.harvard.edu)
The Model Minority Myth | The Practice (thepractice.law.harvard.edu)
Model Minority Stereotype (cmhc.utexas.edu)
What Does Model Minority Mean—And Why Does the Term Cause Harm? Here's What Experts Say (www.msn.com)
pos_context_en: Since its introduction in popular media more than a half century ago, the term “model minority” has often been used to refer to a minority group perceived as particularly successful, especially in a manner that contrasts with other minority groups.
In particular, the model minority designation is often applied to Asian Americans, who, as a group, are often praised for apparent success across academic, economic, and cultural domains
Individuals who identify as Asian American may feel pressured to meet these cultural expectations.

"The model minority myth reduces Asians to a stereotypical image," Chen tells Health. "It doesn't see them as individuals and groups with cultural, class, and other differences. It also attributes so-called 'success' to culture, and implicitly blames those who are deemed as not successful for not trying hard enough."

question_en: How would a bank make money if I deposited 1 billion dollars into my savings, considering the interest would be millions?
pos_context_title_en: Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Finance 101: How Do Banks Make Money? - Money Under 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
pos_context_en:
It all ties back to the fundamental way banks make money: Banks use depositors’ money to make loans. The amount of interest the banks collect on the loans is greater than the amount of interest they pay to customers with savings accounts—and the difference is the banks’ profit.


For example: You currently have an emergency fund of $10,000 in a high yield savings account that may pay 1.50% APY. The bank uses that money to fund someone’s:


* Mortgage at 5.50% APR
* Student loan at 6.65% APR
* Credit card at 16.99% APR


Your bank may have paid you $150 in a year’s time but they earned hundreds or thousands more from the interest on loans (made possible with your money). Now, think about this process repeated with millions of banking customers and billions of dollars.

Yes, banks make a lot of money banks from charging borrowers interest, but the fees banks change are just as lucrative.


* Account fees. Some typical financial products that charge fees are checking accounts, investment accounts, and credit cards. These fees are said to be for “maintenances purposes” even though maintaining these accounts costs banks relatively little.
* ATM fees. There will be times when you can’t find your bank’s ATM and you must settle for another ATM just to get some cash. Well, that’s probably going to cost you $3. Such situations happen all the time and just mean more money for banks.

* Penalty charges. Banks love to slap on a penalty fee for something a customer’s mishaps. It could a credit card payment that you sent in at 5:05PM. It could be a check written for an amount that was one penny over what you had in your checking account. Whatever it may be, expect to pay a late fee or a notorious overdraft fee or between $25 and $40. It sucks for customers, but the banks are having a blast.
* Commissions. Most banks will have investment divisions that often function as full-service brokerages. Of course, their commission fees for making trades are higher than most discount brokers.
* Application fees. Whenever a prospective borrower applies for a loan (especially a home loan) many banks charge a loan origination or application fee. And, they can take the liberty of including this fee amount into the principal of your loan—which means you’ll pay interest on it too! (So if your loan application fee is $100 and your bank rolls it into a 30-year mortgage at 5% APR, you’ll pay $94.40 in interest just on the $100 fee).
question_src: Je! Benki ingefanyaje pesa ikiwa ningeweka dola bilioni 1 kwenye akiba yangu, ukizingatia riba itakuwa mamilioni?
pos_context_title_src: Fedha 101: Benki hufanyaje pesa? - Pesa chini ya 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Fedha 101: Benki hufanyaje pesa? - Pesa chini ya 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
Fedha 101: Benki hufanyaje pesa? - Pesa chini ya 30 (www.moneyunder30.com)
pos_context_src:
Yote inafunga nyuma kwa njia ya msingi benki hufanya pesa: Benki hutumia pesa za amana kufanya mikopo. Kiasi cha riba ambacho benki hukusanya kwenye mikopo ni kubwa kuliko kiasi cha riba wanayolipa kwa wateja walio na akaunti za akiba -na tofauti ni faida ya benki.


Kwa mfano: kwa sasa una mfuko wa dharura wa $ 10,000 katika akaunti kubwa ya akiba ya mavuno ambayo inaweza kulipa 1.50% APY. Benki hutumia pesa hizo kufadhili mtu:


* Rehani kwa 5.50% Aprili
* Mkopo wa mwanafunzi kwa 6.65% Aprili
* Kadi ya mkopo kwa 16.99% Aprili


Benki yako inaweza kuwa imekulipa $ 150 kwa wakati wa mwaka lakini walipata mamia au maelfu zaidi kutoka kwa riba juu ya mikopo (iliyowezekana na pesa yako). Sasa, fikiria juu ya mchakato huu unaorudiwa na mamilioni ya wateja wa benki na mabilioni ya dola.

Ndio, benki hufanya benki nyingi za pesa kutoka kwa malipo ya wakopaji, lakini ada za benki ni za faida tu.


* Ada ya akaunti. Bidhaa zingine za kawaida za kifedha ambazo ada ya malipo ni kuangalia akaunti, akaunti za uwekezaji, na kadi za mkopo. Ada hizi zinasemekana kuwa kwa "madhumuni ya kudumisha" ingawa kudumisha akaunti hizi hugharimu benki kidogo.
* Ada ya ATM. Kutakuwa na wakati ambao huwezi kupata ATM ya benki yako na lazima utatue kwa ATM nyingine ili kupata pesa. Kweli, hiyo itakugharimu $ 3. Hali kama hizi hufanyika wakati wote na inamaanisha pesa zaidi kwa benki.

* Mashtaka ya adhabu. Benki zinapenda kupiga kofi kwa ada ya adhabu kwa kitu ambacho shida za mteja. Inaweza malipo ya kadi ya mkopo ambayo umetuma saa 5:05 jioni. Inaweza kuwa cheki iliyoandikwa kwa kiasi ambacho kilikuwa senti moja juu ya kile ulichokuwa nacho katika akaunti yako ya kuangalia. Chochote kinachoweza kuwa, tarajia kulipa ada ya marehemu au ada mbaya ya overdraft au kati ya $ 25 na $ 40. Inavuta wateja, lakini benki zina mlipuko.
* Tume. Benki nyingi zitakuwa na mgawanyiko wa uwekezaji ambao mara nyingi hufanya kazi kama udalali wa huduma kamili. Kwa kweli, ada yao ya tume ya kutengeneza biashara ni kubwa kuliko madalali wengi wa punguzo.
* Ada ya Maombi. Wakati wowote akopaye anayetarajiwa kutumika kwa mkopo (haswa mkopo wa nyumba) benki nyingi huchaji malipo ya mkopo au ada ya maombi. Na, wanaweza kuchukua uhuru wa kujumuisha kiasi hiki cha ada katika mkuu wa mkopo wako - ambayo inamaanisha kuwa utalipa riba pia! .

question_en: If I were to create a company, have $1M debt, go bankrupt, how would the company that I owe get its money ? do I have to pay ?
pos_context_title_en: If A Company Goes Out of Business Do I Owe Debt to Collection Agency? (www.debtcollectionanswers.com)
When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
When You Might Be Personally Liable for LLC or Corporate Debt (www.nolo.com)
pos_context_en:
The debt you owe as a debtor to a company that goes into bankruptcy administration will become part of the assets of the company in bankruptcy.


However, exactly what happens if you owe money to a company that goes out of business, and how that debt will be collected, depends in part on the status of the debt.



"The fact that a company files for bankruptcy does not automatically erase any


debt you owe."


If a lender is collecting the debt but goes out of business, you will need to continue to make payments on the loan or you risk damage to your credit reports and credit scores. If the company files for bankruptcy, the court will instruct you where to make your monthly payments if that changes. If you have any dispute over whether the debt is valid, raise that dispute as soon as you are notified of the bankruptcy. If you don’t, the debt may be considered valid.

If you cosign on a business loan, you are as equally responsible as the corporation or LLC to pay it back. This is usually the simplest way to voluntarily make yourself liable for your company's debts. Similarly, if you personally guarantee an obligation of the corporation or LLC then the creditor can come after your personal assets if the business defaults on the loan.


## Pledging Your Property as Collateral


If you have a new company or your company does not have many assets, a creditor may require you to provide some sort of collateral before approving the loan. If you agree to pledge your house or other personal assets as collateral for the business loan, the creditor may be able to take your property and sell it to satisfy the obligations of the company.


## Piercing the Corporate Veil


Above we discussed the ways you can voluntarily make yourself personally liable for a corporate or LLC debt. However, a creditor can also try to go after your personal assets by eliminating the limited liability protection provided by the corporation or LLC. This is commonly referred to as piercing the corporate veil.

more likely to pierce the corporate veil if:


* Corporate formalities, such as holding annual meetings and keeping minutes, were not followed.
* Certain owners exerted too much control over the corporation or LLC.
* Owners commingled personal funds with company funds or used personal funds to satisfy company obligations.
* The company was not sufficiently capitalized when it was formed.


(To learn more, see Piercing the Corporate Veil: When LLCs and Corporations May Be at Risk.)


## Fraud


A corporation or LLC's owners may also be held personally liable if they are found to have committed fraud

pos_context_src:
Deni ambalo unadaiwa kama mdaiwa kwa kampuni ambayo inakwenda katika utawala wa kufilisika itakuwa sehemu ya mali ya kampuni hiyo kufilisika.


Walakini, kile kinachotokea ikiwa unadaiwa pesa kwa kampuni inayoenda nje ya biashara, na jinsi deni hilo litakusanywa, inategemea sehemu ya hali ya deni.



"Ukweli kwamba kampuni ya faili ya kufilisi


deni una deni. "


Ikiwa mkopeshaji anakusanya deni lakini anaenda nje ya biashara, utahitaji kuendelea kufanya malipo kwa mkopo au unahatarisha uharibifu wa ripoti zako za mkopo na alama za mkopo. Ikiwa kampuni inatoa faili kwa kufilisika, korti itakuamuru wapi kufanya malipo yako ya kila mwezi ikiwa hiyo itabadilika. Ikiwa una mzozo wowote juu ya kama deni ni halali, ongeza ugomvi huo mara tu utakapoarifiwa kufilisika. Ikiwa haufanyi, deni linaweza kuzingatiwa kuwa halali.

Ikiwa unashikilia mkopo wa biashara, unawajibika sawa na Shirika au LLC kuilipa. Kawaida hii ndio njia rahisi zaidi ya kujifanya kwa hiari kuwajibika kwa deni la kampuni yako. Vivyo hivyo, ikiwa unahakikisha jukumu la shirika au LLC basi mkopeshaji anaweza kuja baada ya mali yako ya kibinafsi ikiwa biashara itafanya mkopo kwa mkopo.


## Kuahidi mali yako kama dhamana


Ikiwa una kampuni mpya au kampuni yako haina mali nyingi, mkopeshaji anaweza kukuhitaji kutoa aina fulani ya dhamana kabla ya kupitisha mkopo. Ikiwa unakubali kuahidi nyumba yako au mali zingine za kibinafsi kama dhamana ya mkopo wa biashara, mkopeshaji anaweza kuchukua mali yako na kuiuza ili kukidhi majukumu ya Kampuni.


## Kutoboa pazia la ushirika


Hapo juu tulijadili njia ambazo unaweza kujifanya kwa hiari kuwajibika kwa deni la ushirika au LLC. Walakini, mkopeshaji anaweza pia kujaribu kufuata mali zako za kibinafsi kwa kuondoa ulinzi mdogo wa dhima iliyotolewa na Shirika au LLC. Hii inajulikana kama kutoboa pazia la ushirika.

uwezekano mkubwa wa kutoboa pazia la ushirika ikiwa:


* Taratibu za ushirika, kama vile kufanya mikutano ya kila mwaka na dakika za kutunza, hazikufuatwa.
* Wamiliki wengine walitoa udhibiti mwingi juu ya shirika au LLC.
* Wamiliki waliunganisha fedha za kibinafsi na fedha za kampuni au walitumia pesa za kibinafsi kukidhi majukumu ya kampuni.
* Kampuni haikuwa na mtaji wa kutosha wakati iliundwa.


(Ili kujifunza zaidi, angalia kutoboa pazia la ushirika: Wakati LLC na mashirika yanaweza kuwa hatarini.)


## Udanganyifu


Wamiliki wa shirika au LLC wanaweza pia kushikiliwa kibinafsi ikiwa wamepatikana wamefanya udanganyifu

question_en: What happens to a plant when you pull a leaf off of it? Are you hurting it and is the plant able to regenerate?

pos_context_en:
There are three main reasons why you should cut off dying leaves:


1. To free up nutrients and encourage new growth
2. To prevent the spread of disease or pests
3. To improve health and appearance
If you have a lot of yellow leaves, you’re better off finding the problem and fixing it – such as overwatering or not enough sunlight.

The big fan leaves absorb light and retain energy for later use by the plant. By pulling these off you are essentially starving your plant of stored nutrients and energy needed for growth and bud production.

question_en: How can water boil below 100°C?
pos_context_title_en: What Is the Boiling Point of Water at Various Altitudes? (www.thespruceeats.com)
Why Does Water Boil Quickly At High Altitudes? » Science ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Effects of Altitude on Water Boiling Time (mountainhouse.com)
pos_context_en:
One of the most significant changes that occur in high altitude areas concerning cooking is the boiling point of water. As the altitude increases, the atmospheric pressure pushing down on water decreases, which allows the water to boil at lower temperatures.


A lower boiling point means that food cooks at a lower temperature, despite the fact that the water is boiling. It is important to recognize just how much the temperature of boiling water is reduced as the altitude increases.

Water molecules have an easy time escaping off the surface when the air pressure above them is less. Since this is a naturally-occurring condition in high altitude regions, the boiling point of water is reduced and thus it attains the boiling

It also impacts the boiling point of water: the temperature at which liquid water begins turning to vapor, which occurs when its vapor pressure equals the atmospheric pressure. At a higher elevation, the lower atmospheric pressure means heated water reaches its boiling point more quickly—i.e., at a lower temperature. Water at sea level boils at 212 degrees Fahrenheit; at 5,000 feet above sea level, the boiling point is 203 degrees F. Up at 10,000 feet, water boils at 194 degrees F.

pos_context_src:
Moja ya mabadiliko muhimu ambayo hufanyika katika maeneo yenye urefu mkubwa juu ya kupikia ni kiwango cha maji. Kadiri urefu unavyoongezeka, shinikizo la anga kusukuma chini juu ya maji hupungua, ambayo inaruhusu maji kuchemsha kwa joto la chini.


Kiwango cha chini cha kuchemsha kinamaanisha kuwa chakula hupika kwa joto la chini, licha ya ukweli kwamba maji yanachemka. Ni muhimu kutambua ni kiasi gani joto la maji ya kuchemsha hupunguzwa kadiri urefu unavyoongezeka.

Molekuli za maji zina wakati rahisi kutoroka kwenye uso wakati shinikizo la hewa juu yao ni kidogo. Kwa kuwa hii ni hali ya kawaida inayotokea katika maeneo yenye urefu wa juu, kiwango cha maji cha kuchemsha hupunguzwa na kwa hivyo hupata kuchemsha

Pia inathiri kiwango cha kuchemsha cha maji: joto ambalo maji ya kioevu huanza kugeuka kwa mvuke, ambayo hufanyika wakati shinikizo la mvuke wake ni sawa na shinikizo la anga. Katika mwinuko wa juu, shinikizo la chini la anga linamaanisha maji yenye joto hufikia kiwango chake cha kuchemsha haraka -i.e., Kwa joto la chini. Maji katika kiwango cha bahari hua kwa nyuzi 212 Fahrenheit; Katika futi 5,000 juu ya usawa wa bahari, kiwango cha kuchemsha ni digrii 203 F. Juu kwa miguu 10,000, majipu ya maji kwa digrii 194 F.

pos_context_en: Native Americans (and indigenous islanders) did not have many diseases on their side to use against the Europeans. Plagues spread quickly between people. Secondly, if you get a plague, either you die or you become immune. If you survive, you will never get it again, because now your body knows how to kill it. However, you can still carry the plague, and you can spread it to other people, but it can't hurt you.

Plagues prosper when you have a civilization/city which does a bad job of separating sewage from drinking water. This can help spread the plague, which helps evolve it fast. This makes deadly plagues. One such city which had bad water management was London.
So, since the New World had less cities (and less population), it had less plagues.

This means that to have a plague, you must have as much contact with animals as possible. In the Old World, where farmers tended for cows and pigs, while warriors rode horses and elephants, there was a much higher chance of accidentally getting a disease from the animal that in the New World, where there was not as much contact between animals and humans.

pos_context_en: Sulfuric acid is the key ingredient of this ultra-strength acidic drain cleaner. It’s potent enough to clear sink and toilet clogs that other cleaners leave behind. Use by pouring one-and-a-half to two cups of cleaner into a drain, waiting for 15 minutes, then flushing for five minutes with cold water.

* Oxidizing drain cleaners contain substances such as household bleach, peroxides and nitrates. These chemicals cause the organic material of the clog to lose electrons and become oxidized. The product is heavier than water, so it can move through standing water, and it releases heat and gas to help clear the blockage. * Acid drain cleaners aren't commonly found in stores, and some are sold only to plumbers. These typically contain high concentrations of sulfuric acid or hydrochloric acid, substances that increase hydronium ions in a solution and attract electrons from the clog. The hydronium ions react chemically with the material in the clog, and the reaction releases heat, which is necessary to melt congealed grease [source: Sheridan].

Be they liquid, gel or powder form, most of the drain cleaners you'll find on store shelves use strong chemicals, and they come in liquid, gel and powder forms. All chemical reactions involve moving electrons, and drain cleaners work by either taking or giving electrons to the clogging substance, generating heat in the process. There are three main types of drain cleaners:

 * Caustic drain cleaners contain substances such as lye and caustic potash. They're bases, so they give electrons to the clogging substance, and their hydroxide ions create the reaction that clears the clog. Their alkaline, or basic, chemicals release heat and turn grease into a soap-like substance that's more easily dissolved. These drain cleaners are typically heavier than water, which enables them to reach the clog through standing water.

pos_context_en:
Living off the land means you survive only by the resources that can be harvested from the land you own.


So, think food, water, and power.

The following values reflect the cost of land, housing, off grid solar system, heating systems, well, septic, transportation, gardens, livestock, and misc expenses. Moving off the grid can cost about $12,000 to $450,000 for common off grid living situations. Average monthly expenses run from $35 to $2,200. This accounts for housing, heating, water, and gardening expenses, that are unique to off grid living,

### Home Insurance


Be aware that off grid homes tend to be farther from fire rescue and other emergency services and tend to have wood heat. This makes home insurance much more expensive than you might be used to. We have seen cases of people paying more than double what the usual rates are.

### Fire Wood


Many people going off grid anticipate cutting their own firewood, but underestimate the effort and cost of buying firewood. Depending on how cold your winters are, the quality of your stove, the type of wood you have access to, and the insulation of your house, you could end up using anywhere from about 3 to 10 cords of wood per season.

A typical garden fence at homestead scale costs around $5,000. Most homesteaders go for a tall wire fence of this kind. Good quality fruit trees run about $60-$80/each. Berries – $15-$20/each. If you are buying seeds each year, then a large family garden would usually cost $100 – $200 per year.

question_en: Anabolism vs. Catabolism, what is each, how does each affect the human body, what the positives/negatives are of each.
pos_context_title_en: Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Anabolism vs. Catabolism: The Role They Play in Your Metabolism (health.clevelandclinic.org)

pos_context_en:
When you think catabolism, think digestion, says DiMarino. This process takes larger structures like proteins, fats or tissues and breaks them down into smaller units such as cells or fatty acids. 


Catabolism occurs when you’re digesting food. For example, it’s the process that dissolves a piece of bread into simple nutrients your body can use, like glucose (blood sugar). And if your body isn’t getting the food and nutrients it needs to fuel daily living, catabolism is the mechanism that breaks down muscle and fat for energy.

### What is anabolism? 


Anabolism is the opposite of catabolism: It’s the mechanism that takes smaller units like nutrients, cells, or amino acids and bonds them together to create bigger structures. 


“One example of anabolism in action is when your body is trying to heal a cut. It adds tissue and structures around that wound,” DiMarino explains. “It’s also the process involved in a child’s growth and in building stronger muscles.”

Catabolism functions no matter what you give your body, states DiMarino. It breaks down food, whether it’s junky or nutritious. Whatever it doesn’t use for energy now, it stores for later (hello, extra pounds). 


But anabolism is entirely different. It only functions properly when you’re getting enough nutrients through foods like vegetables, fruits and lean meats. Your body needs high-quality building blocks to heal, repair and grow.

The major differences between Catabolism and Anabolism are the way the molecules are utilized in the body. Anabolism creates molecules the body needs for functionality and it uses energy in the process. Catabolism, on the other hand, breaks down complex molecules and releases energy which is available for the body to use.

Tofauti kati ya anabolism na catabolism - muhtasari (byjus.com)
pos_context_src:
Unapofikiria catabolism, fikiria digestion, anasema DiMarino. Utaratibu huu unachukua miundo mikubwa kama protini, mafuta au tishu na kuzivunja katika vitengo vidogo kama seli au asidi ya mafuta. 


Catabolism hufanyika wakati unachimba chakula. Kwa mfano, ni mchakato ambao unafuta kipande cha mkate kuwa virutubishi rahisi mwili wako unaweza kutumia, kama sukari (sukari ya damu). Na ikiwa mwili wako haupati chakula na virutubishi unahitaji mafuta ya kuishi kila siku, catabolism ni utaratibu ambao huvunja misuli na mafuta kwa nishati.

####Anabolism ni nini? 


Anabolism ni kinyume cha catabolism: ni utaratibu ambao unachukua vitengo vidogo kama virutubishi, seli, au asidi ya amino na kuzifunga pamoja kuunda muundo mkubwa. 


"Mfano mmoja wa anabolism katika hatua ni wakati mwili wako unajaribu kuponya kata. Inaongeza tishu na miundo karibu na jeraha hilo," DiMarino anafafanua. "Pia ni mchakato unaohusika katika ukuaji wa mtoto na katika kujenga misuli yenye nguvu."

Catabolism inafanya kazi bila kujali unapeana mwili wako, inasema dimarino. Inavunja chakula, iwe ni nzuri au yenye lishe. Chochote ambacho hakitumii kwa nishati sasa, huhifadhi baadaye (hello, pauni za ziada). 


Lakini anabolism ni tofauti kabisa. Inafanya kazi vizuri wakati unapata virutubishi vya kutosha kupitia vyakula kama mboga, matunda na nyama konda. Mwili wako unahitaji vizuizi vya ujenzi wa hali ya juu kuponya, kukarabati na kukua.

Tofauti kuu kati ya catabolism na anabolism ni njia ambayo molekuli hutumiwa katika mwili. Anabolism huunda molekuli mahitaji ya mwili kwa utendaji na hutumia nishati katika mchakato. Catabolism, kwa upande mwingine, huvunja molekuli ngumu na kutoa nishati ambayo inapatikana kwa mwili kutumia.

question_en: Why does my pee smell like asparagus when I eat asparagus but it never smells like anything cool, like lobster tail or ice cream sundae, when I eat something cool?

pos_context_en:
1. Everyone digests food differently and some people can break down the sulfur byproducts more efficiently.
2. Some people lack the ability to detect the odor simply because of genetic variations.

The main culprit is aspargusic acid, which is found exclusively in asparagus. When asparagus is digested, asparagusic acid gets broken down into sulfur containing byproducts. Sulfur, in general, is not very pleasant to smell, notes Dr. Bobart. When you pee, the sulfur byproducts evaporate almost immediately, causing you to smell that unpleasant scent.

The asparagusic acid in asparagus produces many sulfurous byproducts that give your pee a rotten-like smell.


The smell can be detected as early as 15 minutes after eating asparagus and may last up to 14 hours.
One study in 6,909 adults noted that 58% of men and 62% of women had asparagus anosmia, suggesting that this specific genetic modification is quite common

Researchers believe that, during digestion, the vegetable's sulfurous amino acids break down into smelly chemical components in all people. And because those components are "volatile," meaning airborne, the odor wafts upward as the urine leaves the body and can be detected as soon as 15 minutes after you eat this spring delicacy.

pos_context_en:
Squatters rights refers to laws which allow a squatter to use or inhabit another person’s property in the event that the lawful owner does not evict or take action against the squatter.


Typically, squatters rights laws only apply if an individual has been illegitimately occupying a space for a specific period of time. In New York, for example, a squatter can be awarded “adverse possession” under state law if they have been living in a property for 10 years or more.’

Some of the states listed above require the squatter to possess a deed, or to have paid taxes during their occupancy, while others do not. In some states, if the squatter can produce the required documentation, the number of years may be reduced.

On top of that, they also need to use the land as a real owner would. Each jurisdiction and judge will have different criteria for evidence of this, but it could include anything from the tenant maintaining the property to paying utilities or even property taxes.

"People feel sensitive about how much money they are making, they feel there is an overwhelming concern that they're going to be judged by it," explained Dr. Ryan T. Howell, an Associate Professor of Psychology at San Francisco State University, and co-founder of Beyond the Purchase, which allows individuals to discover how their spending choices affect their happiness.

These primal definitions we attach to money (from power and control, to freedom, peace of mind, and security, to love—giving money without strings attached or giving money with strings attached) indicate that we, as a society, too often conflate earning power with success and personal value, and regard a low income as a result of poor choices or even moral failings. “It goes against social conventions to talk about how much money you have or how much money you make,” she told me. “I think there’s also reluctance, among the people I interviewed for my book, to recognize how much money they have, partly because they’re worried they have more.”


Some of that reluctance comes from having a lot of money in a society that is known to be unequal. “It’s convenient, right? That we have this taboo,” Sherman said, in the sense that not talking about money might allow people who have the most of it in a given society to ignore that fact.

Similar forms of this “constant chatter” are found elsewhere as well.
