question_en: What causes us to tear up when we cut onions? Is there a way to prevent this?
pos_context_title_en: Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Why Do Onions Make You Cry? Enzymes, Treatments & More (www.healthline.com)
Why Chopping Onions Makes You Cry (www.webmd.com)
pos_context_en:
Onions spew enzymes and sulfenic acid when their skin is broken. These compounds combine to produce propanethial S-oxide, an irritating gas.


Propanethial S-oxide is a lachrymatory agent, meaning that it generates tears when it touches the eye. Propanethial S-oxide turns into sulfuric acid when it touches the water layer that covers and protects your eyeballs.


But just like onions, your eyes are also equipped with a defense mechanism meant to protect them from harm. When the nerves in each eye detect a lachrymatory agent, they generate tears to flush it out.
The tears you shed while chopping onions are not caused by any type of emotion. They’re reflex tears stimulated by exposure to irritants.

"Your eyes have a set of nerves that detect anything that's potentially harmful to your eyes. Your eyes react to the gas that is formed, and your eyes try to flush it out with tears," Rosa explained in a school news release.


However, onions pose no serious threat to your visual health.


"Chopping onions can cause some burning and irritation and tears. Other than that, it's pretty safe on your eyes. It's a temporary sensation with no known long-term effects, nor will it worsen any other conditions, like pink eye," Rosa said.


Goggles can prevent the gas from reaching your eyes while cutting onions, but they aren't really necessary, he added.


"Some people may cut the onions in a bowl of water," Rosa said. "I'd personally recommend using eye drops, like comfort drops, to help lubricate or rinse the eyes and dilute the gas exposure to the eyes."

Lakini kama vitunguu, macho yako pia yana vifaa na utaratibu wa utetezi uliokusudiwa kuwalinda kutokana na madhara. Wakati mishipa katika kila jicho hugundua wakala wa lachrymatory, hutoa machozi ili kuifuta.
Machozi unayomwaga wakati wa kukata vitunguu hayasababishwa na aina yoyote ya mhemko. Ni machozi ya machozi yaliyochochewa na yatokanayo na irritants.

"Macho yako yana seti ya mishipa ambayo hugundua kitu chochote ambacho kinaweza kuwa na madhara kwa macho yako. Macho yako yanaguswa na gesi ambayo imeundwa, na macho yako yanajaribu kuifuta kwa machozi," Rosa alielezea katika habari ya shule.


Walakini, vitunguu havitii tishio kubwa kwa afya yako ya kuona.


"Kukata vitunguu kunaweza kusababisha kuchoma na kuwasha na machozi. Mbali na hiyo, ni salama kwa macho yako. Ni hisia za muda mfupi ambazo hazina athari za muda mrefu, wala hazitazidi hali nyingine yoyote, kama Jicho la Pink," Rosa alisema.

question_en: How long would it take to see the stars when you take light pollution away?
pos_context_title_en: EarthSky | How many stars can you see? (earthsky.org)
EarthSky | How many stars can you see? (earthsky.org)
EarthSky | How many stars can you see? (earthsky.org)
Globe at Night - What is Light Pollution? (www.globeatnight.org)
light pollution | Definition, Causes, & Facts | Britannica (www.britannica.com)
pos_context_en:
What if you were far away from city lights, on a night with no moon and no clouds or haze. How many stars could you see with your unaided eye?


There’s really no definitive answer to this question. No one has counted all the stars in the night sky, and astronomers use different numbers as theoretical estimates.

Considering all the stars visible in all directions around Earth, the upper end on the estimates seems to be about 10,000 visible stars. Other estimates place the number of stars visible to the eye alone – surrounding the entire Earth – at more like 5,000. At any given time, half of Earth is in daylight. So only half the estimated number – say, between 5,000 and 2,500 stars – would be visible from Earth’s night side.


Plus, another fraction of those visible stars would be lost in the haze all around your horizon. That could bring you down to around 2,000, the number commonly used for these estimates. Just know that it varies depending on a number of factors.

You also have to take into account the brightness of your night sky. Even on a moonless night, the glow of lights from Earth’s surface brightens the sky.


Still, far from city lights – under absolutely perfect conditions of darkness and sky clarity – a young to middle-aged person with normal vision should be able to see thousands of stars.

Light pollution is excessive, misdirected, or obtrusive artificial (usually outdoor) light. Too much light pollution has consequences: it washes out starlight in the night sky, interferes with astronomical research, disrupts ecosystems, has adverse health effects and wastes energy.

Light pollution adversely affects professional and amateur astronomers, as well as casual observers of the night sky, because it severely reduces the visibility of stars and other celestial objects. The reduction in night sky visibility is a result of “skyglow,” upward-directed light emanating from poorly designed or directed lamps and security floodlights. This wasted light is scattered and reflected by solid or liquid particles in the atmosphere and then returned to the eyes of people on the ground, obliterating their view of the night sky.

Makadirio mengine huweka idadi ya nyota inayoonekana kwa jicho pekee - inayozunguka Dunia yote - zaidi kama 5,000. Wakati wowote, nusu ya dunia iko katika mchana. Kwa hivyo ni nusu tu ya idadi inayokadiriwa - sema, kati ya nyota 5,000 na 2,500 - zingeonekana kutoka upande wa usiku wa Dunia.


Pamoja, sehemu nyingine ya nyota hizo zinazoonekana zingepotea kwenye macho pande zote za upeo wako. Hiyo inaweza kukuletea karibu 2000, idadi inayotumika kwa makadirio haya. Jua tu kuwa inatofautiana kulingana na sababu kadhaa.

Lazima pia uzingatie mwangaza wa anga yako ya usiku. Hata usiku usio na mwezi, mwangaza wa taa kutoka kwa uso wa Dunia huangaza angani.


Bado, mbali na taa za jiji-chini ya hali kamili ya giza na uwazi wa anga-kijana mdogo hadi wa kati aliye na maono ya kawaida anapaswa kuona maelfu ya nyota.

Uchafuzi wa mwanga ni wa kupita kiasi, umeelekezwa vibaya, au mwanga wa kawaida (kawaida wa nje). Uchafuzi mwingi wa mwanga una athari: Huosha taa za nyota kwenye anga la usiku, huingiliana na utafiti wa angani, huvuruga mazingira, ina athari mbaya za kiafya na nishati ya taka.

Uchafuzi wa mwanga huathiri vibaya wanaastolojia wa kitaalam na amateur, na vile vile waangalizi wa kawaida wa anga la usiku, kwa sababu inapunguza sana mwonekano wa nyota na vitu vingine vya mbinguni. Kupunguzwa kwa mwonekano wa anga la usiku ni matokeo ya "Skyglow," taa iliyoelekezwa zaidi kutoka kwa taa zilizoundwa au zilizoelekezwa na taa za mafuriko. Nuru hii iliyopotea imetawanyika na kuonyeshwa na chembe ngumu au kioevu angani na kisha kurudishwa kwa macho ya watu ardhini, na kutenganisha maoni yao ya anga la usiku.

question_en: Is there a biological reason that human beings are attracted to certain facial characteristics (such as a defined jawline) or is it just cultural preferences?

pos_context_en: Attractiveness ratings of the images made by male participants relate positively to parameters of skin homogeneity. The authors propose that skin texture is a cue to fertility and health. In contrast to some previous studies, the authors found that dark skin, not light skin, was rated as most attractive.

The Evolutionary Advantage theory proposed that symmetrical faces are perceived as more attractive because the symmetry indicates good health in an individual. Everyone’s genes are designed to develop a face perfectly symmetrical, but as we grow, develop, and then age, disease, infections, and parasites cause imperfection in our appearance (asymmetry). Thus, those that have less asymmetry and imperfections, are perceived as having better and stronger immune systems to withstand the infections and parasites that occur naturally. So, symmetry is a good indicator of a person having good genes to pass on their offspring.

A strong Jawline is attractive to the opposite sex


This is a well documented fact, right from an evolutionary perspective. A strong jawline in men is considered to be a sign of high testosterone levels which translates into greater virility. High testosterone levels are a sign of a strong immune system which means greater strength and stamina; therefore a strong jawline in men is considered a trait that is attractive to women.


Women with sharp jawlines are equally attractive to men and a well defined jawline in women is considered a sign of strength, grace and responsibility; traits that are extremely attractive to men. Some of the most beautiful actresses and models are observed to have an extremely chiseled jawline.

question_en: Why do we prefer cold pillows to warm pillows?
pos_context_title_en: While You Are Sleeping (www.webmd.com)
Learn How to Sleep All Night Naturally and Not Wake Up (amerisleep.com)
Too Hot to Sleep? Lots of Cooling Tips Here (bebrainfit.com)
Here Are The Effects Of Sleeping In A Cold Room | Sleep Advisor (www.sleepadvisor.org)
Here Are The Effects Of Sleeping In A Cold Room | Sleep Advisor (www.sleepadvisor.org)
pos_context_en: It tends to go up and down a little during the day, and the same is true at night, although while you’re sleeping it can be 1 to 2 degrees lower than in the daytime. Body temperature starts to fall as bedtime approaches, paving the way for a good night’s sleep. Your body also tends to lose heat, which helps you fall and stay asleep. That’s one of the reasons experts say you shouldn’t exercise close to bedtime: Exercise heats you up. We sleep better when we’re cooler. Your temperature starts to rise toward morning, preparing your body for wakefulness.
Keep it cool. The ideal temperature for sleep is around 65°, so set your thermostat accordingly. If that seems too chilly for comfort, experiment to find the temperature that’s right for you.

During this part of the sleep cycle, you lose some of your ability to thermoregulate, i.e., adjust your inner temperature to the surrounding air temperature.


So when the room temperature is too warm, your body starts to heat up which can wake you and make it hard to get back to sleep.

A stressful day and an overactive brain aren’t the only things keeping you awake at night. Studies show that people who suffer from insomnia tend to have a warmer core body temperature before falling asleep than so-called normal people.


Remember that our bodies cool off at night in anticipation of sleep. But if your body automatically runs hot, you’ll have to alter your environment to cool your temperature down enough to signal that it’s time for bed.

Sleeping barefoot and sticking one or both feet out from under the covers will help keep you cooler. We lose a lot of body heat through our head, hands, and feet, so allowing your feet to breathe has a cooling effect.

question_en: Shutter Speed and Aperture.
pos_context_title_en: Understanding ISO, Shutter Speed and Aperture - A Beginner's Guide (photographylife.com)
Understanding ISO, Shutter Speed and Aperture - A Beginner's Guide (photographylife.com)

pos_context_en: Shutter Speed – the length of time a camera shutter is open to expose light into the camera sensor. Shutter speeds are typically measured in fractions of a second, when they are under a second. Slow shutter speeds allow more light into the camera sensor and are used for low-light and night photography, while fast shutter speeds help to freeze motion.

Aperture – a hole within a lens, through which light travels into the camera body. The larger the hole, the more light passes to the camera sensor. Aperture also controls the depth of field, which is the portion of a scene that appears to be sharp. If the aperture is very small, the depth of field is large

changing aperture also changes depth of field, while changing shutter speed alters the appearance of moving objects. In other words, you can also adjust aperture for depth of field or shutter speed to produce the effect of motion.

Kasi za kufunga polepole huruhusu mwanga zaidi ndani ya sensor ya kamera na hutumiwa kwa upigaji picha wa chini na usiku, wakati kasi ya kufunga haraka husaidia kufungia mwendo.

Aperture - shimo ndani ya lensi, kupitia ambayo mwanga husafiri ndani ya mwili wa kamera. Kubwa shimo, taa zaidi hupita kwa sensor ya kamera. Aperture pia inadhibiti kina cha shamba, ambayo ni sehemu ya eneo ambalo linaonekana kuwa mkali. Ikiwa aperture ni ndogo sana, kina cha shamba ni kubwa

Kubadilisha aperture pia hubadilisha kina cha uwanja, wakati kubadilisha kasi ya shutter hubadilisha muonekano wa vitu vya kusonga. Kwa maneno mengine, unaweza pia kurekebisha aperture kwa kina cha uwanja au kasi ya kufunga ili kutoa athari ya mwendo.

question_en: Seismologists: How do you determine whether an earthquake was naturally occurring or if it was human induced?
pos_context_title_en: Human-Induced and Natural Earthquakes are 'Inherently Similar,' According to LSA Researcher | U-M LSA U-M College of LSA (lsa.umich.edu)
Natural or manmade quakes? New Stanford technique can tell the difference (news.stanford.edu)
Manmade and natural earthquakes not so different after all (earth.stanford.edu)
pos_context_en:
Huang's work discovered that stresses released by natural and human-caused earthquakes are similar, which means that the same tools might be used to predict both.


"Our study shows that induced earthquakes and natural earthquakes in the central U.S. are inherently similar, and we can predict the damaging effects of induced earthquakes using the same framework as natural earthquakes," said Huang.

A new study by Stanford researchers suggests that earthquakes triggered by human activity follow several indicative patterns that could help scientists distinguish them from naturally occurring temblors.

The research concludes that human-induced and naturally occurring earthquakes in the central U.S. share the same shaking potential and can thus cause similar damage.


The finding contradicts previous observations suggesting that induced earthquakes exhibit weaker shaking than natural ones. The work could help scientists make predictions about future earthquakes and mitigate their potential damage.

question_en: How do we synchronize our pace when walking next to someone?
pos_context_title_en: Walking Together May Resolve Conflicts During the Pandemic (www.psychologytoday.com)
Mirror neuron system (www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov)
In sync and in control? (newsroom.ucla.edu)
In sync and in control? (newsroom.ucla.edu)
pos_context_en:
Social walking is one way to activate "mirror-neuron networks."


We mimic each other’s pace and gait, swinging our arms and legs in unison. This entrains other physical processes: Our breathing becomes more synchronized and our heart rates increase and decrease (as we walk faster or slower, up-hill or down) at similar times. Walking together also elicits social-cognitive processing to help us understand the other person’s intentions and plans and process their social cues (speech, expression, gesture) in order to anticipate their movements and predict their trajectory.

Mirror neuron system is a group of specialized neurons that “mirrors” the actions and behaviour of others. The involvement of mirror neuron system (MNS) is implicated in neurocognitive functions (social cognition, language, empathy, theory of mind) and neuropsychiatric disorders.

We have found that when men are walking in step with other men, they think that a potential foe is smaller and less physically formidable and less intimidating than when they’re just walking in no particularly coordinated manner with other men

Even though each participant was accompanied only by a single companion, those who walked in unison with their partners judged the angry man as significantly less physically imposing than did the study subjects who had not walked in unison with their confederate: On average, they estimated that the man in the photo was about an inch shorter than the other participants did.

Hii inaingiza michakato mingine ya mwili: kupumua kwetu kunakuwa zaidi ya kusawazisha na viwango vya moyo wetu huongezeka na kupungua (tunapoenda haraka au polepole, up-kilima au chini) kwa nyakati sawa. Kutembea pamoja pia kunasababisha usindikaji wa utambuzi wa kijamii kutusaidia kuelewa nia na mipango ya mtu mwingine na kusindika tabia zao za kijamii (hotuba, kujieleza, ishara) ili kutarajia harakati zao na kutabiri mwenendo wao.

Mfumo wa Neuron ya Mirror ni kikundi cha neurons maalum ambazo "huonyesha" vitendo na tabia ya wengine. Kuhusika kwa mfumo wa neuron ya kioo (MNS) kunahusishwa katika kazi za neva (utambuzi wa kijamii, lugha, huruma, nadharia ya akili) na shida za neuropsychiatric.

question_en: Why are Video game QA jobs so terrible?
pos_context_title_en: The Class Of Quality Assurance (www.gamesindustry.biz)
The Horrible World Of Video Game Crunch (kotaku.com)
Quality Assured: What It’s Really Like To Test Games For A Living (kotaku.com)
The Tough Life of a Games Tester - IGN (www.ign.com)
The Tough Life of a Games Tester - IGN (www.ign.com)
pos_context_en: Quality Assurance, or game testing, has a bad reputation in the games industry. In some ways it's justified: the working conditions can be grim and the pay incredulously low. But, more damaging and dangerous, the bad reputation is often promoted and propagated by in-house attitudes towards QA that brands staff "minions"; low-level, disposable work-horses who'll do the most mundane of tasks for hours on end.

. Crunch, as it’s called, has become status quo for the video game industry, as routine to game developers’ lives as daily commutes or lunch breaks. From multimillion-dollar blockbusters like Call of Duty to niche RPGs like Trails, just about every video game in history is the net result of countless overtime hours, extra weekends, and free time sacrificed for the almighty deadline

QA testers also have to deal with game development’s other systemic issues—particularly, mandatory crunch and frequent layoffs. Big developers tend to hire dozens of QA testers toward the end of big projects only to let them all go once the game ships. Instead of partying with the rest of the developers, they’re out looking for new jobs.
Because playing videogames all day as a career has been heavily glamorized, companies are never at a loss for willing recruits. "Everyone in QA is expendable,
Once the product ships, you're out of a job. There are no benefits, no perks and definitely no promise of being hired full time.

This happens when the front wheel rotation becomes imbalanced during the ride. Not handling the imbalance of the bike would result in a crash.


Speed and other physical forces put the burden on the tires, making it harder for them to control the pressure during a high-speed ride

Distribution of weight centered more toward the rear of the bike causes the front end of the bike to loose stability at speed.

question_en: how a shark can detect blood from kilometres away. Do some molecules of the blood have to 'reach' the shark?
pos_context_title_en: Can A Shark Really Smell A Drop Of Blood From A Mile Away? (www.ripleys.com)
Shark Senses - Shark Facts and Information (www.sharks-world.com)
pos_context_en:
Even though there’s just a 1 in 3.7 million chance of being killed by a shark, people are so fearful of the predators that they’ve developed myths about them—such as their ability to smell a tiny drop of blood from miles away.


While sharks do have a strong sense of smell, this statement is largely overblown. Some sharks can identify blood a quarter-mile away, but the scent doesn’t reach them instantaneously or necessarily cause them to attack.


[Image: blue shark nostrils]


Sharks have a heightened sense of smell and olfactory system that is hundreds of times stronger than a human’s. Their nostrils, located beneath their snouts, are used only for smelling and not for breathing. They do have the capacity to detect tiny amounts of various compounds in the water. Some types of sharks, such as the lemon shark, can even detect a scent in a large swimming pool or a substance that is several hundred meters away.


But a shark more than a quarter-mile away won’t smell your blood and decide to make you into a yummy snack. Smells reach a shark through the currents, and it would take time for the scent to travel that distance to a shark’s nostrils. The motion of the ocean carries smell molecules with it, so, the more motion, the faster the smell will travel.


If you do start to bleed while swimming in the ocean, there is some time to get safely to shore in case a rogue shark decides to attack.

Sharks have nostrils that they only use to smell. When they swim, water flows through the nostrils, is introduced into the nasal duct and moves the last folds of the skin that has sensory cells. Some sharks, such as the lemon shark (Negaprion brevirostris), can detect a small amount of blood in the water.


The sense of smell is directional, this means that if the aroma comes from the left side of the shark, the shark first perceives it precisely in the left fossa rather than the right and can detect the location of the source of the smelling.


It is necessary to emphasize that they are very sensitive to odors and can differentiate a prey from another shark and even from a predator and respond in a decisive way to the smell produced by a wounded or fearful prey.

Papa zina hisia ya kunukia na mfumo wa uhuishaji ambao ni mamia ya mara zaidi ya mwanadamu. Pua zao, ziko chini ya snout zao, hutumiwa tu kwa harufu na sio kwa kupumua. Aina zingine za papa, kama vile papa wa limao, zinaweza kugundua harufu mbaya katika dimbwi kubwa la kuogelea au dutu ambayo iko umbali wa mita mia kadhaa.


Lakini papa zaidi ya robo ya maili hautavuta damu yako na kuamua kukufanya uwe vitafunio. Harufu hufikia papa kupitia mikondo, na itachukua muda kwa harufu mbaya kusafiri umbali huo kwa pua za papa. Mwendo wa bahari hubeba molekuli za harufu nayo, kwa hivyo, mwendo zaidi, harufu itasafiri haraka.


Ikiwa utaanza kutokwa na damu wakati wa kuogelea baharini, kuna wakati wa kupata salama pwani ikiwa mtu mkali ataamua kushambulia.

Papa zina pua ambazo hutumia tu harufu. Wakati wao kuogelea, maji hutiririka kupitia pua, huletwa ndani ya duct ya pua na kusonga folda za mwisho za ngozi ambazo zina seli za hisia. Maana ya harufu ni ya mwelekeo, hii inamaanisha kwamba ikiwa harufu inatoka upande wa kushoto wa papa, papa kwanza hugundua kabisa katika fossa ya kushoto badala ya kulia na inaweza kugundua eneo la chanzo cha harufu.

question_en: How do firewalls work?
pos_context_title_en: How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
How do firewalls work? Firewall technology explained (cybersecurity.att.com)
pos_context_en:
Firewalls filter network traffic so that you only receive data that you should be getting. No firewall works perfectly, and a lot of a firewall's effectiveness depends on how you configure it.


To get a basic grasp of how firewalls work, it's important to understand how TCP packets work.


The data that your computer sends and receives over the internet or an internal network is comprised of TCP packets and UDP packets. TCP packets can be more effectively filtered by firewalls because they contain more information in their headers.


[Image]


TCP packets contain information such as source and destination addresses, packet sequence information, and payload. That information allows your network interface to deliver data properly, and a firewall can compare that information to the rules you configured it with. For example, all HTTPS data is transmitted through TCP packets. When HTTPS data is sent to your computer through your network interface while you surf the web, your operating system will know that it's data that's supposed to go to your web browser. The same applies if you are surfing the web - on your phone, on your PC, or even on a server machine in your datacenter. With the proliferation of the Internet of Things, you might even be surfing the web from a touchscreen embedded in your refrigerator. Your HTTPS data is used the same way regardless.
UDP packets can be filtered by port, but their headers lack the information that TCP packets have for more sophisticated filtering.
Stateless or packet filtering firewalls inspect each packet individually, without considering the trends of the data you're receiving.

Stateful firewalls do what stateless firewalls do, and they also consider the connection states of streams of data. This is the bouncer who may see one high school kid and then reject the whole group of high school kids, rather than asking each of them to prove their age. Stateful firewalls will collect a series of packets before it determines their connection state, and then compares those findings to the firewall rules, rather than applying the rules to each individual packet of data.
3. Application firewalls generally do everything that stateful firewalls do, and they also analyze the actual data content of the packets, not just the headers.

Firewall vichungi trafiki ya mtandao ili upate tu data ambayo unapaswa kupata. Hakuna firewall inayofanya kazi kikamilifu, na ufanisi mwingi wa firewall inategemea jinsi unavyoisanidi.


Ili kupata ufahamu wa kimsingi wa jinsi milango ya moto inavyofanya kazi, ni muhimu kuelewa jinsi pakiti za TCP zinavyofanya kazi.


Takwimu ambazo kompyuta yako hutuma na kupokea kwenye mtandao au mtandao wa ndani unajumuisha pakiti za TCP na pakiti za UDP. Pakiti za TCP zinaweza kuchujwa kwa ufanisi zaidi na milango ya moto kwa sababu zina habari zaidi katika vichwa vyao.


[Picha]


Pakiti za TCP zina habari kama anwani za chanzo na marudio, habari ya mlolongo wa pakiti, na upakiaji wa malipo. Habari hiyo inaruhusu interface yako ya mtandao kutoa data vizuri, na firewall inaweza kulinganisha habari hiyo na sheria ulizoisanidi. Kwa mfano, data yote ya HTTPS hupitishwa kupitia pakiti za TCP. Wakati data ya HTTPS inatumwa kwa kompyuta yako kupitia interface yako ya mtandao wakati unapita kwenye wavuti, mfumo wako wa kufanya kazi utajua kuwa ni data inayotakiwa kwenda kwenye kivinjari chako cha wavuti. Hiyo inatumika ikiwa unatumia wavuti - kwenye simu yako, kwenye PC yako, au hata kwenye mashine ya seva kwenye daftari lako. Kwa kuenea kwa mtandao wa vitu, unaweza kuwa unatumia mtandao kutoka kwa skrini iliyoingizwa kwenye jokofu yako. Takwimu zako za HTTPS hutumiwa kwa njia ile ile bila kujali.
Pakiti za UDP zinaweza kuchujwa na bandari, lakini vichwa vyao havina habari ambayo pakiti za TCP zinazo kwa kuchuja zaidi.
Vipodozi visivyo na vifurushi vya kuchuja au pakiti hukagua kila pakiti moja kwa moja, bila kuzingatia mwelekeo wa data unayopokea.

Matambara ya moto hufanya kile milango isiyo na maana hufanya, na pia wanazingatia hali za unganisho za mito ya data. Huyu ndiye bouncer ambaye anaweza kuona mtoto mmoja wa shule ya upili na kisha kukataa kundi lote la watoto wa shule ya upili, badala ya kumuuliza kila mmoja wao kudhibitisha umri wao. Firewalls za serikali zitakusanya safu ya pakiti kabla ya kuamua hali yao ya unganisho, na kisha kulinganisha matokeo hayo na sheria za moto, badala ya kutumia sheria kwa kila pakiti ya data.
3. Matumizi ya moto kwa ujumla hufanya kila kitu ambacho moto wa moto hufanya, na pia huchambua yaliyomo halisi ya data, sio vichwa tu.

pos_context_en:
Our data shows that those who bully are far more likely than average to have experienced a stressful or traumatic situation in the past 5 years. Examples include their parents/guardians splitting up, the death of a relative or the gaining of a little brother or sister.


It makes sense because we all respond to stress in very different ways. Some of us use positive behaviours, such as meditation, exercise and talking therapy – all designed to relieve the stress.


Others use negative behaviours such as bullying, violence and alcohol abuse, which temporarily mask the issues but usually make them worse in the long-term.


The research shows that some people simply do not know how to positively respond to stress and so default to bullying others as a coping mechanism.

66% of the people who had admitted to bullying somebody else were male. Take a minute to think about how guys are raised in our culture and compare that to the ways in which girls are raised. The moment a guy starts to show any sign of emotion, he’s told to man up and to stop being a girl.
In order to mask how they actually feel about themselves, some people who bully focus attention on someone else.
Our research shows that those who have experienced bullying are twice as likely to go on and bully others. Maybe they were bullied as kids in the past, or maybe they are being bullied now.

Without access to education, hate-based conversation directed at others may be the norm. They may not understand what hate speech is and why speaking about people in a derogatory way is not appropriate.

Finally, those who bully are more likely to feel like their friendships and family relationships aren’t very secure. In order to keep friendships, they might be pressured by their peers to behave in a certain way.

question_en: If people can build their own computers, what is stopping people from building their own smartphones?
pos_context_title_en: Yes, you can build your own smartphone (www.zdnet.com)
I want to build my own smartphone (forums.tomsguide.com)
Make Your Own Cellphone From Scratch. (www.instructables.com)
pos_context_en:
A number of people have asked me whether it possible to build a smartphone out of easily available parts. Absolutely. It won't be as sleek or as powerful as one you could pick up, and you will have to assemble it yourself, but it's one of those projects that's very doable.


Here's one example built around a Raspberry Pi board, and Adafruit Fona GSM board, a 5-megapixel camera, 802.11n Wi-Fi, and a 3.5-inch display. You'll have to shop around for some of these parts, but the last time I looked they were all still available.


Now, this might not be a device that you want to carry around with you as a daily smartphone, but it's something that you could integrate into a bigger project, such as an IoT hub or maybe a rugged handset for use in an off-road vehicle or boat.

It's probably near impossible to build your own smartphone. It's not just that simple that you need the motherboard, and the processor. There are much more things you need to worry about as well. storage chip, accelerometer, compass, two cameras, radio chip (incorporating GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cellular), USB controller chip, Micro-USB port, LCD panel, capacitive touchscreen, battery, slider, keyboard, case, etc.... Most of the suppliers are from china. And I don't think you live in China. Even if you live in China, you probably have to contact all the suppliers in china (possibly over 100) to get the individual parts of a smartphone.

n fact, you can make a cellphone in much the same way you'd make anything else: find the right parts, figure out how to connect them together, and try to do it in a way that's attractive and robust. Because of the ubiquity of cellphones, there are companies making the components they're made of; with some digging, I was able to find versions of these parts that are possible to buy in small quantities and that are possible to assemble by hand. This wasn't necessarily easy, but it's a very different problem than trying to learn the physics needed to understand how a cellphone tower works

pos_context_src:
Watu kadhaa wameniuliza ikiwa inawezekana kujenga smartphone nje ya sehemu zinazopatikana kwa urahisi. Kabisa. Haitakuwa nyembamba au yenye nguvu kama moja unayoweza kuchukua, na itabidi ujikusanyie mwenyewe, lakini ni moja wapo ya miradi hiyo ambayo inawezekana sana.


Hapa kuna mfano mmoja uliojengwa karibu na bodi ya Raspberry Pi, na bodi ya Adafruit Fona GSM, kamera ya 5-megapixel, 802.11n Wi-Fi, na onyesho la inchi 3.5. Itabidi ununue karibu kwa sehemu zingine, lakini mara ya mwisho nilionekana wote walikuwa bado wanapatikana.


Sasa, hii inaweza kuwa sio kifaa ambacho unataka kubeba karibu na wewe kama smartphone ya kila siku, lakini ni kitu ambacho unaweza kujumuisha katika mradi mkubwa, kama vile kitovu cha IoT au labda kifaa cha rugged cha matumizi katika gari la barabarani au mashua.

Labda karibu haiwezekani kujenga smartphone yako mwenyewe. Sio rahisi tu kwamba unahitaji ubao wa mama, na processor. Kuna mambo mengi zaidi unahitaji kuwa na wasiwasi juu yake pia. Chip ya kuhifadhi, kasi, dira, kamera mbili, chip ya redio (ikijumuisha GPS, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, na simu za rununu), Chip ya Mdhibiti wa USB, bandari ndogo ya USB, jopo la LCD, skrini ya kugusa, betri, slider, kibodi, kesi, nk .... wengi wa wauzaji ni kutoka China. Na sidhani kama unaishi China. Hata kama unaishi China, labda lazima uwasiliane na wauzaji wote nchini China (ikiwezekana zaidi ya 100) kupata sehemu za kibinafsi za smartphone.

Kwa kweli, unaweza kutengeneza simu ya rununu kwa njia ile ile ambayo utafanya kitu kingine chochote: pata sehemu zinazofaa, fikiria jinsi ya kuziunganisha pamoja, na jaribu kuifanya kwa njia ambayo inavutia na nguvu. Kwa sababu ya ubiquity wa simu za rununu, kuna kampuni zinatengeneza vifaa ambavyo vimetengenezwa; Na kuchimba kadhaa, niliweza kupata matoleo ya sehemu hizi ambazo zinawezekana kununua kwa idadi ndogo na ambazo zinawezekana kukusanyika kwa mkono. Hii haikuwa rahisi, lakini ni shida tofauti sana kuliko kujaribu kujifunza fizikia inayohitajika kuelewa jinsi mnara wa rununu unavyofanya kazi

question_en: Who are the Kurdish people?
pos_context_title_en: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Today, the Kurds are spread across four nations. Who are they? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
pos_context_en: Kurds (Kurdish: کورد ,Kurd‎) or Kurdish people are an Iranian[28][29][30] ethnic group native to a mountainous region of Western Asia known as Kurdistan, which spans southeastern Turkey, northwestern Iran, northern Iraq, and northern Syria.[31] There are exclaves of Kurds in Central Anatolia, Khorasan, and the Caucasus, as well as significant Kurdish diaspora communities in the cities of western Turkey (in particular Istanbul) and Western Europe (primarily in Germany). The Kurdish population is estimated to be between 30 and 45 million.[2][32]

The term gained the characteristic of an ethnonym following the Muslim conquest of Persia, as it was adopted into Arabic and gradually became associated with an amalgamation of Iranian and Iranicised tribes and groups in the region.[41][42]

Many Kurds consider themselves descended from the Medes, an ancient Iranian people,[83] and even use a calendar dating from 612 BC, when the Assyrian capital of Nineveh was conquered by the Medes.[84] The claimed Median descent is reflected in the words of the Kurdish national anthem: "We are the children of the Medes and Kai Khosrow."

If you can’t point to Kurdistan on a map, you’re not alone: It’s not a sovereign country. But for Kurds, an ethnic group of roughly 30 million people, it is very real indeed. Nestled on the margins of Turkey, Iran, Iraq, and Syria, Kurdistan is one of the planet’s most volatile regions, and its people are the world’s largest stateless group.


The Kurds are indigenous to the Middle East, but scholars and Kurdish people alike disagree as to the group’s origin. Nor do all Kurds share a religious identity: Though the majority of Kurds are Sunni Muslims, other religions are practiced as well.


What is clear is a Kurdish ethnic identity and common language. Those commonalities emerged around the Middle Ages. Since then, Kurds have played roles in the histories of what are now Iran, Iraq, Syria, and Turkey.


But while they flourished and wielded influence in the region, Kurds lost their lands when the Ottoman Empire took over most Kurdish-held territory in the 1500s.
question_src: Watu wa Kikurdi ni nani?
pos_context_title_src: Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Kurds (en.wikipedia.org)
Leo, Wakurdi wameenea katika mataifa manne. Ni akina nani? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
pos_context_src: Kurds (Kikurdi: کورد, Kurd) au watu wa Kikurdi ni Irani [28] [29] [30] kabila la asili ya mkoa wa mlima wa Magharibi mwa Asia inayojulikana kama Kurdistan, ambayo inachukua kusini mashariki mwa Uturuki, kaskazini magharibi mwa Irani, Iraq kaskazini, na kaskazini mwa Syria. [31] Kuna ubaya wa Kurds katikati mwa Anatolia, Khorasan, na Caucasus, pamoja na jamii muhimu za Kurdish diaspora katika miji ya Uturuki Magharibi (haswa Istanbul) na Ulaya Magharibi (haswa nchini Ujerumani). Idadi ya Wakurdi inakadiriwa kuwa kati ya milioni 30 hadi 45. [2] [32]

Neno hilo lilipata tabia ya ethnonym kufuatia ushindi wa Waislamu wa Uajemi, kama ilivyopitishwa kwa Kiarabu na polepole ikahusishwa na kuunganishwa kwa makabila na vikundi vya Irani na vya Irani. [41] [42]

Wakurdi wengi hujiona wametoka kwa Wamedi, watu wa zamani wa Irani, [83] na hata hutumia kalenda iliyoanzia 612 KK, wakati mji mkuu wa Ashuru wa Ninawi ulishindwa na Wamedi. [84] Asili inayodaiwa ya wastani inaonyeshwa kwa maneno ya wimbo wa kitaifa wa Kikurdi: "Sisi ni watoto wa Wamedi na Kai Khosrow."

Ikiwa huwezi kuashiria Kurdistan kwenye ramani, hauko peke yako: sio nchi huru. Lakini kwa Kurds, kabila la watu takriban milioni 30, ni kweli sana. Iliyowekwa kwenye pembezoni mwa Uturuki, Iran, Iraqi, na Syria, Kurdistan ni moja wapo ya maeneo tete ya sayari, na watu wake ndio kikundi kikubwa kisicho na takwimu ulimwenguni.


Wakurdi ni wa asili kwa Mashariki ya Kati, lakini wasomi na watu wa Kikurdi hawakubaliani juu ya asili ya kikundi hicho. Wala Wakurdi wote hawashiriki kitambulisho cha kidini: Ingawa Wakurdi wengi ni Waislamu wa Sunni, dini zingine zinafanywa pia.


Kinachoonekana wazi ni kitambulisho cha kikabila cha Kikurdi na lugha ya kawaida. Mawazo hayo yalitokea katika Zama za Kati. Tangu wakati huo, Kurds wamecheza majukumu katika historia ya kile ambacho sasa ni Iran, Iraqi, Syria, na Uturuki.


Lakini wakati walifanikiwa na kutumia ushawishi katika mkoa huo, Kurds walipoteza ardhi zao wakati Dola ya Ottoman ilichukua eneo lililoshikiliwa na Kikurdi katika miaka ya 1500.

question_en: Dictionary tells me agnostic means "I think it can't be proven" but commonly in North America people seem to use it to mean "kinda don't believe in God". Why is that?
pos_context_title_en: What Is The Difference Between Agnosticism And Atheism? (www.worldatlas.com)
What Does "Agnostic" Mean? (www.psychologytoday.com)
pos_context_en: Agnostic people believe that the existence of God or a supernatural being is unknown and beyond human reason. The phrase “agnosticism” was first used by Thomas Henry Huxley against religious people who accused him of denouncing the role of God in the creation of the universe. Huxley supported the theories of evolution by Charles Darwin and did not subscribe to religious beliefs. He believed that nature was too diverse to have been created and that natural selection provided a better explanation provable by evidence. Huxley thought that agnosticism was a principle and not a belief. He reiterated that it is wrong for one to claim a phenomenon is a definite truth unless logical evidence is provided. The word was coined as the antagonist of the phrase “Gnosticism,” meaning “knowledge.” Gnosticism was a religious ideology in the first and second centuries that suggested that the material world was ungodly while the spirit world was the better choice. Although agnosticism was not intended to raise the question of whether God exists or not, it found its way to the religious world. Huxley justified his stand by claiming that he did not deny or affirm the mortality or human and therefore, did not see the reason to believe or disprove the existence of God. He challenged the religious and atheists to prove or disprove the presence of God.

“Maybe there is a God, but maybe not. I’m just not sure. I mean, who can really say?”


If you’ve ever uttered such words or heard someone else utter them, you’re dealing with agnosticism.


“Agnostic” is a label people often use to indicate that they embrace an orientation somewhere between the serene surety of knowing that there is a God and the conviction that there isn’t.


That is, while a theist is someone who believes in God, and an atheist is someone who does not believe in God, an agnostic is someone who isn’t convinced that God exists, but at the same time, can’t be totally sure that God doesn’t exist. And given a lack of knowledge concerning the question of God’s existence – or the lack of any possibility of such knowledge -- an agnostic simply sighs and shrugs, offering an unapologetic “Who knows?” to the whole matter.


In the words of philosopher Julian Baggini, an agnostic “claims we cannot know whether God exists and so the only rational option is to reserve judgment.”
question_src: Kamusi inaniambia njia ya agnostic "Nadhani haiwezi kuthibitika" lakini kawaida katika Amerika ya Kaskazini watu wanaonekana kuitumia kumaanisha "kinda usiamini Mungu". Kwa nini hiyo?
pos_context_title_src: Je! Ni tofauti gani kati ya agnosticism na kutokuwepo kwa Mungu? (www.worldatlas.com)
Je! "Agnostic" inamaanisha nini? (www.psychologytoday.com)
pos_context_src: Watu wa Agnostic wanaamini kuwa uwepo wa Mungu au kiumbe wa asili haijulikani na zaidi ya sababu ya kibinadamu. Maneno "agnosticism" yalitumiwa kwanza na Thomas Henry Huxley dhidi ya watu wa dini ambao walimshtaki kwa kukemea jukumu la Mungu katika uumbaji wa ulimwengu. Huxley aliunga mkono nadharia za mageuzi na Charles Darwin na hakujiunga na imani za kidini. Aliamini kuwa maumbile yalikuwa tofauti sana kuwa yameundwa na kwamba uteuzi wa asili ulitoa maelezo bora yanayoweza kudhibitishwa na ushahidi. Huxley alidhani kwamba agnosticism ilikuwa kanuni na sio imani. Alisisitiza kwamba ni vibaya kwa mtu kudai jambo ni ukweli dhahiri isipokuwa ushahidi wa kimantiki umetolewa. Neno hilo liliundwa kama mpinzani wa kifungu "Gnosticism," ikimaanisha "maarifa." Gnosticism ilikuwa itikadi ya kidini katika karne ya kwanza na ya pili ambayo ilionyesha kwamba ulimwengu wa nyenzo ulikuwa mbaya wakati ulimwengu wa roho ndio chaguo bora. Ingawa agnosticism haikukusudiwa kuibua swali la ikiwa Mungu yuko au la, ilipata njia ya ulimwengu wa kidini. Huxley alihalalisha msimamo wake kwa kudai kwamba hakukataa au kudhibitisha vifo au mwanadamu na kwa hivyo, hakuona sababu ya kuamini au kupinga uwepo wa Mungu. Alimpa changamoto ya kidini na wasioamini kuwa Mungu ili kudhibitisha au kupinga uwepo wa Mungu.

"Labda kuna Mungu, lakini labda sivyo. Sina uhakika. Namaanisha, ni nani anayeweza kusema kweli?"


Ikiwa umewahi kusema maneno kama haya au kusikia mtu mwingine akisema, unashughulika na agnosticism.


"Agnostic" ni lebo ambayo watu hutumia mara nyingi kuashiria kuwa wanakumbatia mwelekeo mahali fulani kati ya dhamana ya kujua kwamba kuna Mungu na imani kwamba hakuna.


Hiyo ni, wakati theist ni mtu anayemwamini Mungu, na mtu asiyeamini kuwa Mungu ni mtu ambaye haamini katika Mungu, mtu asiye na imani ni mtu ambaye haamini kuwa Mungu yuko, lakini wakati huo huo, hawezi kuwa na uhakika kabisa kuwa Mungu hayupo. Na ukizingatia ukosefu wa maarifa juu ya swali la uwepo wa Mungu - au ukosefu wa uwezekano wowote wa maarifa kama hayo - mtu anayeweza kuugua tu na kunasa, akitoa "anajua" nani? " kwa jambo zima.


Kwa maneno ya mwanafalsafa Julian Baggini, agnostic "anadai hatuwezi kujua ikiwa Mungu yuko na kwa hivyo chaguo la busara ni kuhifadhi hukumu."

question_en: when anticipating pain, such as a rubber band snapping skin, why do we feel a tingling sensation in our legs?
pos_context_title_en: Paresthesia: Causes of Pins and Needles, Numbness, and "Skin Crawling" (www.webmd.com)
Causes of Tingling Sensations in the Body - You are Mom (youaremom.com)
Causes of Tingling Sensations in the Body - You are Mom (youaremom.com)
pos_context_en: Paresthesia happens because of pressure on a nerve. When that pressure is gone -- you uncross your legs, for example -- the feeling goes away.

Temporary paresthesia, also known as tingling, is a fairly uncomfortable sensation that can be experienced in any part of the body. However, it usually occurs in our extremities, which is to say our arms, hands, legs, and feet.


When this happens, it’s understood that the central and peripheral nervous systems are involved. To put it in simple terms, this occurs when some kind of pressure is exerted on the nerve terminals, generally in the extremities.

Now, you may be wondering why this sensation happens mainly in the arms and legs. The reason is that it’s quite common for us to exert pressure on these areas by sitting, leaning, or holding a certain position for a long period of time.


When this happens, we put pressure on the nerves in the area in question, which are responsible for transmitting information between the body and the brain.


Additionally, the pressure involved in the posture cuts off the blood vessels that bring oxygen to the nerves. As such, these cannot send information to the brain.


[Image: Causes of Tingling Sensations in the Body]


Tingling begins when the pressure is relieved and the nerves resume transmitting their signals, albeit in a delayed manner.

pos_context_src: Paresthesia hufanyika kwa sababu ya shinikizo kwenye ujasiri. Wakati shinikizo hiyo imekwisha - unafunua miguu yako, kwa mfano - hisia huenda.

Paresthesia ya muda, pia inajulikana kama kuuma, ni hisia zisizofurahi ambazo zinaweza kupatikana katika sehemu yoyote ya mwili. Walakini, kawaida hufanyika katika miisho yetu, ambayo ni kusema mikono yetu, mikono, miguu, na miguu.


Wakati hii inafanyika, inaeleweka kuwa mifumo ya neva ya kati na ya pembeni inahusika. Ili kuiweka kwa maneno rahisi, hii hufanyika wakati aina fulani ya shinikizo inatolewa kwenye vituo vya ujasiri, kwa ujumla katika miisho.

Sasa, unaweza kuwa unashangaa kwanini hisia hizi hufanyika hasa mikononi na miguu. Sababu ni kwamba ni kawaida kwetu kutoa shinikizo kwenye maeneo haya kwa kukaa, kutegemea, au kushikilia msimamo fulani kwa muda mrefu.


Wakati hii inafanyika, tunaweka shinikizo kwenye mishipa katika eneo linalohusika, ambalo lina jukumu la kupitisha habari kati ya mwili na ubongo.


Kwa kuongeza, shinikizo linalohusika katika mkao hupunguza mishipa ya damu ambayo huleta oksijeni kwenye mishipa. Kama hivyo, hizi haziwezi kutuma habari kwa ubongo.


[Picha: Sababu za hisia za kutetemeka mwilini]


Kutetemeka huanza wakati shinikizo linapoondolewa na mishipa huanza kusambaza ishara zao, pamoja na kucheleweshwa.

question_en: Explain: Having a "stone" in your saliva gland.
pos_context_title_en: Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Salivary Stones (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Salivary Gland Stones: Symptoms, Causes, and Treatment (www.webmd.com)
Salivary stones: Symptoms, causes, and how to get rid of them (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
pos_context_en: Salivary stones, also called sialolithiasis, are hardened mineral deposits that form in the salivary glands. The condition is more likely to affect people age 30 to 60 and men are more likely to get salivary stones than women.

The cause is not known, but several factors are associated with salivary stone formation:


* Dehydration, due to inadequate fluid intake, illness, or medications such as diuretics (water pills) and anticholinergic drugs


* Trauma to the inside of the mouth


* Smoking


* Gum disease

A salivary gland stone -- also called salivary duct stone -- is a calcified structure that may form inside a salivary gland or duct. It can block the flow of saliva into the mouth.


The majority of stones affect the submandibular glands located at the floor of the mouth. Less commonly, the stones affect the parotid glands, located on the inside of the cheeks, or the sublingual glands, which are under the tongue. Many people with the condition have multiple stones.

Salivary stones form when chemicals in the saliva accumulate in the duct or gland. They mostly contain calcium. The exact cause is not known. But factors contributing to less saliva production and/or thickened saliva may be risk factors for salivary stones. These factors include: dehydration, poor eating, and use of certain medications including some antihistamines, blood pressure drugs, psychiatric drugs, and bladder control drugs. Trauma to the salivary glands may also raise the risk for salivary stones.

Salivary stones are rarely serious, and a person can often treat them at home.


Home remedies for getting rid of salivary stones include:


* Sucking on citrus fruits or hard candies. Sucking on a wedge of lemon or orange increases the flow of saliva, which can help dislodge the stone. A person can also try sucking on sugar-free gum or hard, sour candies, such as lemon drops.
* Drinking plenty of fluids. Regular fluid intake helps keep the mouth hydrated and can increase saliva flow.
* Gentle massage. Gently massaging the affected area may relieve pain and encourage the stone to pass through the salivary duct. The Sjogren’s Syndrome Foundation have an illustrated guide on how to do this on their website.
* Medications. Some over-the-counter drugs, such as ibuprofen and acetaminophen, can help relieve pain and swelling.
* Sucking on ice cubes. Sucking on something cold, such as an ice cube or ice pop, may also help reduce pain and swelling resulting from salivary stones.
question_src: Fafanua: kuwa na "jiwe" kwenye gland yako ya mshono.
pos_context_title_src: Mawe ya Salivary (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Mawe ya Salivary (www.hopkinsmedicine.org)
Mawe ya tezi ya tezi: Dalili, sababu, na matibabu (www.webmd.com)
Mawe ya tezi ya tezi: Dalili, sababu, na matibabu (www.webmd.com)
Mawe ya Salivary: Dalili, sababu, na jinsi ya kuwaondoa (www.medicalnewsstoday.com)
pos_context_src: Mawe ya salivary, ambayo pia huitwa sialolithiasis, ni amana ngumu za madini ambazo huunda kwenye tezi za mate. Hali hiyo ina uwezekano mkubwa wa kuathiri watu wenye umri wa miaka 30 hadi 60 na wanaume wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kupata mawe ya mate kuliko wanawake.

Sababu haijulikani, lakini sababu kadhaa zinahusishwa na malezi ya jiwe la mshono:


* Upungufu wa maji mwilini, kwa sababu ya ulaji duni wa maji, ugonjwa, au dawa kama vile diuretics (vidonge vya maji) na dawa za anticholinergic


* Kiwewe ndani ya mdomo


* Uvutaji sigara


* Ugonjwa wa fizi

Jiwe la tezi ya tezi - pia huitwa jiwe la duct ya mshono - ni muundo uliowekwa ambao unaweza kuunda ndani ya tezi ya mshono au duct. Inaweza kuzuia mtiririko wa mshono kinywani.


Mawe mengi huathiri tezi ndogo ndogo ziko kwenye sakafu ya mdomo. Chini ya kawaida, mawe huathiri tezi za parotid, ziko ndani ya mashavu, au tezi za chini, ambazo ziko chini ya ulimi. Watu wengi walio na hali hiyo wana mawe mengi.

Mawe ya salivary huunda wakati kemikali kwenye mshono hujilimbikiza kwenye duct au tezi. Wao zaidi huwa na kalsiamu. Sababu halisi haijulikani. Lakini sababu zinazochangia uzalishaji mdogo wa mshono na/au mshono mnene unaweza kuwa sababu za hatari kwa mawe ya mshono. Sababu hizi ni pamoja na: upungufu wa maji mwilini, kula vibaya, na matumizi ya dawa fulani ikiwa ni pamoja na antihistamines, dawa za shinikizo la damu, dawa za akili, na dawa za kudhibiti kibofu cha mkojo. Kiwewe kwa tezi za mate zinaweza pia kuongeza hatari kwa mawe ya mshono.

Mawe ya mshono ni mara chache mbaya, na mtu mara nyingi anaweza kuwatibu nyumbani.


Tiba za nyumbani kwa kuondoa mawe ya mshono ni pamoja na:


* Kunyonya matunda ya machungwa au pipi ngumu. Kunyonya kwenye kabari ya limao au machungwa huongeza mtiririko wa mshono, ambayo inaweza kusaidia kutengua jiwe. Mtu anaweza pia kujaribu kunyonya fizi isiyo na sukari au pipi ngumu, tamu, kama matone ya limao.
* Kunywa maji mengi. Ulaji wa maji ya kawaida husaidia kuweka mdomo kuwa na maji na inaweza kuongeza mtiririko wa mshono.
* Upole massage. Kuweka kwa upole eneo lililoathiriwa linaweza kupunguza maumivu na kutia moyo jiwe kupita kwenye duct ya mshono. Shirika la Sjogren's Syndrome lina mwongozo ulioonyeshwa juu ya jinsi ya kufanya hivyo kwenye wavuti yao.
* Dawa. Dawa zingine za kukabiliana na, kama vile ibuprofen na acetaminophen, zinaweza kusaidia kupunguza maumivu na uvimbe.

question_en: Do people who hear for the first time, after something like getting hearing implants, know what the other people are saying?

Cochlear Implant: Cost, Pros, Cons, Risks, How It Works (www.healthline.com)
pos_context_en:
Most children will require at least some speech therapy, depending what age they received their implants. Training time ranges from a year to 12 (I clocked in at 11) and varies in terms of intensity. As they learn how to listen, their brains are doing heavy lifting by burning new neural pathways. Some of them will never listen or speak like someone born hearing due to various factors out of people’s control.


Hearing—or, rather, the perception of it—isn’t a light switch you flip on and off. It’s serious business.

Cochlear implants use a sound processor that fits behind the ear. The processor captures sound signals and sends them to a receiver implanted under the skin behind the ear. The receiver sends the signals to electrodes implanted in the snail-shaped inner ear (cochlea).


The signals stimulate the auditory nerve, which then directs them to the brain. The brain interprets those signals as sounds, though these sounds won't be just like normal hearing.


It takes time and training to learn to interpret the signals received from a cochlear implant. Within a year of use, most people with cochlear implants make considerable gains in understanding speech.
Though the brain will notice the sounds, they’re not the same as normal hearing. Speech therapy and rehabilitation are necessary to learn how to properly interpret these sounds.

pos_context_en: It is also possible that a clipped, nasal, "all-treble" acoustic quality sometimes associated with the Mid-Atlantic accent arose out of technological necessity in the earliest days of radio and sound film, which ineffectively reproduced natural human bass tones.[57] As used by actors, the Mid-Atlantic accent is also known by various other names, including American Theater Standard or American stage speech.[54]

This consciously learned accent was a blend of American English and British English which favoured neither. Its premise was to neutralise strong accents and eliminate Britishisms and Americanisms so that the speaker could be understood on both sides of the Atlantic Ocean. Hence its name.

One theory as the origins of the accent comes from the “announcer English” used by radio broadcasters. Due to the poor quality of microphone and loudspeakers at the time, the speaker needed to enunciate very clearly and use a lot of emphases to ensure their audience could understand them.

[blockquote align=”none” author=”William Labov”]teaching of this pronunciation declined sharply after the end of World War II. As a result, this American version of a ‘posh’ accent has all but disappeared even among the American upper classes
YouTube page BrainStuff has a short video that explains why the people in old movies might have that unique accent. It’s called t

BrainStuff explains that according to Professor Jay O’Berski, this nasally, clipped pronunciation is a vestige from the early days of radio. Receivers had very little bass technology at the time, and it was very difficult – if not impossible – to hear bass tones on your home device.

question_en: Why can't we just dump all our trash in molten lava to rid of it instead of having it seep and pollute the ground water while in the landfill?
pos_context_title_en: Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Why we can't dump all our trash into volcanoes? (www.scienceabc.com)
Garbage into volcanoes: How safe is it to dump rubbish into volcanoes? (www.scientificmystery.com)
pos_context_en:
Lava lakes are undeniably complex and unpredictable wonders of nature. Being extremely hot, they can melt plenty of things, but not everything. There are thousands of forms of plastic, rubber, fabrics and other such materials that would float atop the viscous lava, rather than sinking into the heated void.


[Image: Lava_Lake_Nyiragongo]


An active Lava Lake (Photo Credit: Cai Tjeenk Willink /Wikimedia Commons)


Secondly, lava lakes are not infinitely deep. All that melted trash would have to end up somewhere, and while most of it might vanish in plumes of smoke and vapour – the smoke emanating from that destruction would be incredibly harmful to breathe or send up into the atmosphere.


As terrifying and wrathful as lava lakes are, in reality, they do have a finite volume, and are often on the move up and out of the vent, due to the incredible pressures building up inside.

Lava lakes are unstable beneath their semi-solid, comparatively cool upper layer. If you pierce their surfaces with a relatively cold object, like a piece of trash, the sudden transfer of heat could trigger a chain reaction of explosions. The upper layer starts melting down, releasing pressurized acidic steam and fumes from the vaporized trash. A single tin can might serve as a trigger to start this chain reaction and invoke the wrath of the previously stagnant lava lake!


[Image: Related image]


A chain reaction in action ( https://africageographic.com/blog/hot-as-hell-at-erta-ale/)


Now, imagine the impact of throwing an entire nation’s garbage in a volcano… unimaginably destructive chain reactions would begin. To put this in perspective, minute rockfalls into lava lakes of Hawaiian volcanoes have forced lava more than 85 m (280 feet) into the air. The scenario with tons of garbage would be far more treacherous and perilous for anyone working on the garbage-disposal task.

There are three types of volcanoes – strato, shield, and dome. Out of these, an ideal volcano to dump the trash would be a shield volcano. It is low profile lava, i.e. it has a slow eruption, with lave slowly spewing out onto the earth. However, the numbers of them are not very common. There are only 600 shield volcanoes, with most of them being inactive. There is the number of stratovolcanoes scattered on the earth, but they are known for their explosive nature. Thus, they are definitely not the spot for the dump.


[Image]


Credit-Tropical-Helicopters


Above all, disposing the trash into the lava would be a very expensive method. We have to have the endless stream of trucks traveling to the nearest active volcano to dispose of the trash. An even bigger problem is that there are not as many active volcanoes in the world; there are only 1500 potentially active volcanoes worldwide. When most of the countries don’t have any active volcano, the problem for those countries would still persist.

pos_context_en:
According to the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), the spread of Ebola in the affected African countries is due to a lack of medical professionals, treatment facilities, and supplies. In addition, not enough people in these countries understand how the disease is spread and how to keep it from spreading to others.

The CDC is trying to make sure that people who appear sick do not get on a plane to come to the US. They are also screening people arriving from countries known to have Ebola. Finally, even if someone does develop Ebola after returning to the US, our public health system has a strong ability to track people and their contacts. Our health care system has plenty of supplies, medicines, doctors, and nurses with the know-how to treat and stop it from spreading.

Eighteen people are reported to have been infected, of which nine have died. Although vaccines against Ebola exist and have been rolled out, there is the fear that these small clusters of infection could ignite into something much, much larger.

What’s unusual about the virus that has caused this new outbreak is that it doesn’t seem to have come from an animal but from a human.

Ebola is spread by direct contact with body fluids. It is not spread through the air the way influenza is. If it were, there would be millions of cases of Ebola throughout Africa, just as there are tens of millions of flu cases in this country every year.
But individual cases will not lead to widespread outbreaks, if healthcare workers make diagnoses quickly and the correct protocols are followed. This will protect healthcare workers from Ebola,

pos_context_en: Computers crash because of errors in the operating system (OS) software or errors in the computer hardware. Software errors are probably more common, but hardware errors can be devastating and harder to diagnose.
Corrupted System Registry Files
Every Windows-based PC has something called a Windows registry. The registry contains several files that are integral to the performance and operation of your computer

#2: Disorganized Files


Windows operating systems handle file organization in a way that isn’t very intuitive. Basically, they break files up and fit them into gaps in the computer’s memory. As time goes by, these disorganized files can prompt frequent crashes

#3: Malicious Software


Malicious software can take many different forms. Sometimes, it’s a virus that is accidentally unleashed after opening a strange email; other times, its adware that tags along with other information that is automatically downloaded from a website.

#4: Too Little Available Memory

question_en: How can a vehicle's air filter effect its gas mileage?

pos_context_en: Dirty air filters reduce airflow – Air filters trap contaminants in a media made of paper and synthetic fibers. Over time, this media becomes filled with dirt and debris, preventing the engine from breathing properly. As a result, the engine will work harder and use more fuel.

One of the biggest reasons to change your air filter regularly. Some studies indicate that replacing a dirty air filter increases fuel mileage on older, carburated cars by as much as 14 percent if the filter is so dirty it affects driveability. In addition, changing a clogged air filter can potentially increase acceleration by 6 to 11 percent on modern fuel-injected cars. Other studies claim a 10 percent increase in gas mileage and up to 15¢ per gallon fuel savings. Regardless of the exact figures, it is obvious that a clean air filter improves air flow to the engine and increases engine performance and gas mileage.

When your air filter is dirty, your engine is forced to work harder, resulting in poor fuel economy, higher emissions and, possibly, a loss of engine power. In turn, as a worst-case scenario, a clogged cabin air filter can lead to under-performance of the A/C system, causing weak air flow from the cabin vents. It can also lead to unwanted, unfiltered air in the cabin. As for a mucked-up fuel filter, that’ll land you with a weakened fuel supply to injectors, a reduction in engine power, poor acceleration and lousy fuel economy—not to mention a potential breakdown.

While there are Raspberry Pi builds less than $100 that can give you respectable H.264 and Blu-ray quality playback, I prefer a full-sized HTPC that provides HDMI 1.4 output, HD audio bit streaming, 7.1 surround sound, DVR functionality, speedy boot times and a significant amount of storage for your personal library of video content.


Personally, I prefer starting with the case over any other component. The components within my home theater are a point of presentation for me when I have friends over and the HTPC is always a topic of conversation when I’m zipping through XBMC searching for something to watch. The size of the case also dictates what type of motherboard is required for your build. Mini-ITX and Micro ATX are popular choices among HTPC enthusiasts that want to make a minimal impact on their home theaters; popular brands include Lian Li and nMEdiaPC.

If you want a showpiece within your setup, consider picking up a regular-sized ATX case. Silverstone, Moneual Labs and Thermaltake all manufacture large ATX cases that look very similar to a standard surround sound receiver. While more expensive than smaller cases, this style can include a digital touchscreen display, a large audio knob for the volume and a variety of programmable buttons. For a less expensive solution in this category, check out APEVIA cases. If you are looking for something truly unique to attract attention, nMEDIAPC makes a fantastic wooden PC case that looks like an old-timey radio that would have been used many decades ago.


Remember that case material and size are factors in cooling the HTPC. A heavier case is often a better choice than a lightweight case in order to cut down on vibration and noise when the fans are running. Larger cases are easier to cool as well, thus allowing for additional hard drives and other components down the line. Be aware that larger fans for an ATX case will usually generate more noise than fans within a Micro ATX case, so look for case fans that are specifically marketed as silent.

question_en: Why does smoking tobacco cause cancer, but smoking marijuana does not?
pos_context_title_en: Cancer Risk | NAS | Marijuana (www.cdc.gov)

pos_context_en:
* Smoked cannabis has many of the same cancer-causing substances as smoked tobacco3. Due to the risks it poses to lung health, experts strongly caution against smoking cannabis and tobacco products.
* More research is needed to know if smoking cannabis increases a person’s risk for lung cancer. However, it is difficult to determine whether there is a link, because cannabis use often overlaps other behaviors related to lung cancer, such as tobacco use.

Tobacco smoke has at least 70 chemicals that cause cancer, also known as carcinogens. Every time you breathe in that smoke, those chemicals get into your bloodstream, which carries the chemicals to all parts of your body. Many of these chemicals can damage your DNA, which controls how your body makes new cells and directs each kind of cell to do what it is made for. Damaged DNA can make cells grow differently from how they are supposed to. These unusual cells can turn into cancer.

question_en: how does peeing after sex prevent infections when the urethra and vagina are two different holes?
pos_context_title_en: UTIs and urinating after sexual intercourse: What is the link? (www.medicalnewstoday.com)

pos_context_en:
Experts debate whether urinating after sex helps prevent UTIs.


Many health authorities, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), recommend urinating after sex to prevent UTIs. Doing so may help flush away bacteria that are close to the urethra and prevent them from entering the urinary tract.


However, research published in a 2016 edition of American Family Physician suggests that urinating after sex does not have any measurable protective effects. Still, the researchers note, it is a safe and reasonable thing to do.
Bacteria in the genital or anal region can enter the urethra during sex if a person does not wash their hands between touching the anus and genitals.
During sex, bacteria can get into your urethra, the tube that carries urine out of your body. That can raise your chances of an infection. When you pee, you flush those germs out.

question_en: why are there so many third class levers in our body?
pos_context_title_en: Third-Class Levers in the Human Body | Science project | Education.com (www.education.com)
Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Levers work to create movement in the human body (us.humankinetics.com)
Basic Biomechanics: Levers (www.aaronswansonpt.com)
pos_context_en:
In a third-class lever, the input force is in between the output force and the fulcrum. An example of this class of lever is a baseball bat. The handle of the bat is the fulcrum, you supply the input force near the middle, and the other end of the bat that pushes the ball with the output forces. In a third-class lever, the input force is greater than the output force but the output load is able to move farther.

[Image: Examples of Levers]

You have several third-class levers in your body. One that is easy to investigate is your forearm.

Bones, ligaments, and muscles are the structures that form levers in the body to create human movement. In simple terms, a joint (where two or more bones join together) forms the axis (or fulcrum), and the muscles crossing the joint apply the force to move a weight or resistance. Levers are typically labeled as first class, second class, or third class. All three types are found in the body, but most levers in the human body are third class.

There are numerous third-class levers in the human body; one example can be illustrated in the elbow joint (figure 1.23b). The joint is the axis (fulcrum). The resistance (weight) is the forearm, wrist, and hand. The force is the biceps muscle when the elbow is flexed.

## Mechanical Advantage in Biomechanics

It may seem confusing that most of the muscles in the human body are 3rd class levers, since these levers are at a mechanical disadvantage in terms of effort versus load. However, this only holds true in terms of resistance. The opposite is true when you consider the distal lever displacement. A small arc of motion proximally at the muscle insertion will create large angular displacement and velocity distally. Since most human movement is aimed at maximizing angular displacement of a distal segment through space, the use of 3rd class levers for is very efficient.

This creates a relationship between the lever arm distance, distal angular displacement/velocity, and torque production. The shorter the lever arm of the effort force (decreased mechanical advantage), the greater angular displacement and angular velocity of the distal end of the lever for a given arc of displacement of the effort force. The larger the lever arm of the effort force (increased mechanical advantage), the increased torque production.

This lever arm and force/torque production relationship needs to be taken into consideration when assessing movement and prescribing interventions. For example, applying a 5 pound weight at the distal end of a lever during a scaption/SLR exercise creates a mechanical disadvantage for the supraspinatus/illiopsoas. This results in the muscle being overloaded in attempt to create the amount of torque necessary for the distal angular displacement.

pos_context_title_src: Levers darasa la tatu katika mwili wa mwanadamu | Mradi wa Sayansi | Education.com (www.education.com)
Levers hufanya kazi kuunda harakati katika mwili wa mwanadamu (us.humankinetics.com)
Levers hufanya kazi kuunda harakati katika mwili wa mwanadamu (us.humankinetics.com)
Biomechanics ya msingi: Levers (www.aarononwansonpt.com)
pos_context_src:
Katika lever ya darasa la tatu, nguvu ya pembejeo iko kati ya nguvu ya pato na kamili. Mfano wa darasa hili la lever ni bat ya baseball. Ushughulikiaji wa bat ni kamili, unasambaza nguvu ya pembejeo karibu na katikati, na mwisho mwingine wa bat ambao unasukuma mpira na vikosi vya pato. Katika lever ya darasa la tatu, nguvu ya pembejeo ni kubwa kuliko nguvu ya pato lakini mzigo wa pato una uwezo wa kusonga mbele.

[Picha: mifano ya levers]

Una levers kadhaa za darasa la tatu mwilini mwako. Moja ambayo ni rahisi kuchunguza ni mkono wako.

Mifupa, mishipa, na misuli ni miundo ambayo huunda miili mwilini kuunda harakati za wanadamu. Kwa maneno rahisi, pamoja (ambapo mifupa miwili au zaidi hujiunga pamoja) huunda mhimili (au fulcrum), na misuli inayovuka pamoja inatumia nguvu kusonga uzito au upinzani. Levers kawaida huitwa kama darasa la kwanza, darasa la pili, au darasa la tatu. Aina zote tatu hupatikana katika mwili, lakini wapeanaji wengi katika mwili wa mwanadamu ni darasa la tatu.

Kuna levers kadhaa za darasa la tatu katika mwili wa mwanadamu; Mfano mmoja unaweza kuonyeshwa kwenye kiwiko cha pamoja (Mchoro 1.23b). Pamoja ni mhimili (fulcrum). Upinzani (uzani) ni mkono, mkono, na mkono. Nguvu ni misuli ya biceps wakati kiwiko kinabadilishwa.

## Manufaa ya mitambo katika biomechanics

Inaweza kuonekana kuwa ya kutatanisha kuwa misuli mingi kwenye mwili wa mwanadamu ni levers darasa la tatu, kwani levers hizi ziko kwenye shida ya mitambo katika suala la juhudi dhidi ya mzigo. Walakini, hii inashikilia kweli katika suala la upinzani. Kinyume chake ni kweli wakati unazingatia uhamishaji wa lever ya distal. Arc ndogo ya mwendo haswa kwenye kuingizwa kwa misuli itaunda uhamishaji mkubwa wa angular na kasi ya mbali. Kwa kuwa harakati nyingi za wanadamu zinalenga kuongeza uhamishaji wa angular wa sehemu ya mbali kupitia nafasi, utumiaji wa levers za darasa la 3 ni mzuri sana.

Hii inaunda uhusiano kati ya umbali wa mkono wa lever, uhamishaji wa angular/kasi, na uzalishaji wa torque. Mfupi wa mkono wa nguvu ya nguvu ya juhudi (ilipungua faida ya mitambo), uhamishaji mkubwa wa angular na kasi ya angular ya mwisho wa distal wa lever kwa arc fulani ya kuhamishwa kwa nguvu ya juhudi. Mkono mkubwa wa nguvu ya nguvu ya juhudi (kuongezeka kwa faida ya mitambo), uzalishaji ulioongezeka wa torque.

Urafiki huu wa mkono na nguvu/uhusiano wa uzalishaji wa torque unahitaji kuzingatiwa wakati wa kukagua harakati na kuagiza uingiliaji. Kwa mfano, kutumia uzito wa pauni 5 mwisho wa distal wa lever wakati wa mazoezi ya scaption/SLR huunda shida ya mitambo kwa supraspinatus/illiopsoas. Hii inasababisha misuli kuwa imejaa kupita kiasi kujaribu kuunda kiwango cha torque muhimu kwa uhamishaji wa angular wa distal.

question_en: Asking for my class, what's a gerund?
pos_context_title_en: What is a Gerund? Definition, Examples & Exercises (www.gingersoftware.com)
Gerunds // Purdue Writing Lab (owl.purdue.edu)
What is a Gerund? Definition, Examples of Gerunds (writingexplained.org)
pos_context_en: Gerunds are words that are formed with verbs but act as nouns. They’re very easy to spot, since every gerund is a verb with ing tacked to its tail. There are no exceptions to this rule.

. A gerund is a verbal ending in -ing that is used as a noun.
2. A gerund phrase consists of a gerund plus modifier(s), object(s), and/or complement(s).
3. Gerunds and gerund phrases virtually never require punctuation

Gerund definition: A gerund is a noun formed from a verb. A gerund will always contain the ending “-ing.”


What are gerunds? Any verb ending in “-ing” and used as a noun is a gerund.


Examples of Gerunds:


Verb/Gerund


* to run/running
* I run every day. / I like running.


In the first sentence, “run” is used as a verb. I am “doing” the action “to run.” In the second sentence, “running” is used as a gerund (noun) and “like” is the verb.


* to sing/singing
* Sara sings. Singing makes Sara happy.


In the first sentence, “sings” is used as a verb. Sara is “doing” the action “to sing.” In the second sentence, “singing” is used as a gerund and “makes” is the verb.


Note: A gerund will always be used as a noun and does not replace the progressive form of the verb.

question_en: Why are countries like Iran and Saudi Arabia seemingly unfazed (or otherwise not extremely worried) by the recent drastic drop in oil prices, but Venezuela's economy is quickly becoming one of the worst in the world, due mainly to the same drop in oil?

pos_context_en: A price war between world oil producers has slashed Venezuela’s revenue for its top export and exacerbated the country’s financial crisis as it also faces the coronavirus pandemic, U.S. sanctions and sliding crude output.

More than 90% of Venezuela’s export revenue comes from oil. The country risks generating less than $8 billion this year, a third of $25 billion in 2019, according to Caracas-based economic consultancy Ecoanalitica. Two other local consultants also projected the government will have less than half the funds it managed last year.

Saudi Arabia is expected to hike its crude oil production to 10 million barrels per day (bpd) by the end of 2021, up by 1.5 million bpd from May, due to rising global oil demand, Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday.

The global demand rebound and the strong domestic recovery in oil demand also prompted Goldman to raise its economic growth projections of Saudi Arabia. The U.S. investment bank now sees the Saudi economy rising by 4.5 percent in 2021, compared to an earlier forecast of 2.5 percent growth.

The oil-rich nations in the Middle East, including Saudi Arabia, Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Syria, Qatar, Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Yemen, and Oman, account for about 3.4 percent of the world’s total land surface. However, these countries contain around 38 percent of the world’s total natural gas reserves and 48 percent of the total known reserves of crude oil (Sorkhabi, 2010). When people think about the Middle East, they think about oil. According to 2020 data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration, around 27 percent of the world’s current oil production is sourced from this region. For as long as fossil fuels have been a primary source of global energy, the Middle East has been one of the world’s foremost oil and gas suppliers. Because of the region’s ability to produce and sell massive quantities of oil and gas, economic development in the Middle East has largely been fueled by the fossil fuel industry.

Nchi hiyo ina hatari ya kutoa chini ya dola bilioni 8 mwaka huu, theluthi ya dola bilioni 25 mwaka 2019, kulingana na ushauri wa kiuchumi wa Caracas Ecoanalitica. Washauri wengine wawili wa eneo hilo pia walikadiria serikali itakuwa na chini ya nusu ya fedha zilizosimamiwa mwaka jana.

Saudi Arabia inatarajiwa kuongezeka uzalishaji wake wa mafuta yasiyosafishwa hadi mapipa milioni 10 kwa siku (BPD) hadi mwisho wa 2021, hadi milioni 1.5 bpd kutoka Mei, kwa sababu ya kuongezeka kwa mahitaji ya mafuta ulimwenguni, Goldman Sachs alisema Jumanne.

Mahitaji ya ulimwengu na uokoaji mkubwa wa ndani katika mahitaji ya mafuta pia ulimfanya Goldman kuongeza makadirio yake ya ukuaji wa uchumi wa Saudi Arabia. Benki ya Uwekezaji ya Merika sasa inaona uchumi wa Saudia unakua kwa asilimia 4.5 mnamo 2021, ikilinganishwa na utabiri wa mapema wa ukuaji wa asilimia 2.5.

Mataifa yenye utajiri wa mafuta katika Mashariki ya Kati, pamoja na Saudi Arabia, Iran, Iraqi, Kuwait, Syria, Qatar, Bahrain, Falme za Kiarabu (UAE), Yemen, na Oman, zinachukua asilimia 3.4 ya uso wa ardhi ulimwenguni. Walakini, nchi hizi zina karibu asilimia 38 ya akiba ya jumla ya gesi asilia ulimwenguni na asilimia 48 ya akiba inayojulikana ya mafuta yasiyosafishwa (Sorkhabi, 2010). Wakati watu wanafikiria juu ya Mashariki ya Kati, wanafikiria juu ya mafuta. Kulingana na data 2020 kutoka kwa Utawala wa Habari wa Nishati ya Merika, karibu asilimia 27 ya uzalishaji wa sasa wa mafuta ulimwenguni hutolewa kutoka mkoa huu. Kwa muda mrefu kama mafuta ya mafuta yamekuwa chanzo cha msingi cha nishati ya ulimwengu, Mashariki ya Kati imekuwa moja ya wauzaji wa mafuta na gesi ulimwenguni. Kwa sababu ya uwezo wa mkoa wa kutengeneza na kuuza idadi kubwa ya mafuta na gesi, maendeleo ya uchumi katika Mashariki ya Kati yamechochewa sana na tasnia ya mafuta.
